sentences.text: January 25, 2017

sentences.text: Dear Shareholder:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are cordially invited to attend the Annual Meeting of Shareholders to be held at 9:00 a.m. local time on Wednesday, March 8, 2017, at our headquarters located at One Technology Way, Norwood, Massachusetts 02062.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Annual Meeting you are being asked to elect nine members of our Board of Directors, each to serve for a term expiring at the next annual meeting of shareholders; to vote on a non-binding advisory proposal on the compensation of our named executive officers; to vote on a non-binding advisory proposal on the frequency of future advisory votes on the compensation of our named executive officers; and to ratify the selection of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the 2017 fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR the election of each of the directors named in the proxy statement, FOR the approval, on an advisory basis, of the compensation of our named executive officers, FOR an advisory vote EVERY YEAR on the compensation of our named executive officers, and FOR the ratification of the selection of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the 2017 fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please carefully review the attached proxy materials and take the time to cast your vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Yours sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vincent Roche President and Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ray Stata Chairman of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTICE OF 2017 ANNUAL MEETING OF SHAREHOLDERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To Be Held On March 8, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To our Shareholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders of Analog Devices, Inc. will be held at our headquarters at One Technology Way, Norwood, Massachusetts 02062, on Wednesday, March 8, 2017 at 9:00 a.m. local time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the meeting, shareholders will consider and vote on the following matters:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. To elect the nine director nominees named in this proxy statement to our Board of Directors, each to serve for a term expiring at the next annual meeting of shareholders;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. To approve, by non-binding say on pay vote, the compensation of our named executive officers, as described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, executive compensation tables and accompanying narrative disclosures in this proxy statement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. To hold a non-binding say on frequency vote regarding the frequency of future advisory votes on the compensation of our named executive officers (every year, every two years, or every three years); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. To ratify the selection of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending October 28, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The shareholders will also act on any other business that may properly come before the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead of mailing a paper copy of our proxy materials to all of our shareholders, this year we are providing access to our proxy materials over the Internet under the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commissions notice and access rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, we are mailing to our shareholders a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (the Notice) instead of a paper copy of this proxy statement and our Annual Report for the fiscal year ended October 29, 2016 (the 2016 Annual Report).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are mailing the Notice on or about January 25, 2017, and it contains instructions on how to access those documents over the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice also contains instructions on how each of our shareholders can receive a paper copy of our proxy materials, including this proxy statement, our 2016 Annual Report, and a form of proxy card or voting instruction card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shareholders who do not receive the Notice, including shareholders who have previously requested to receive paper copies of proxy materials, will receive a paper copy of the proxy materials by mail unless they have previously requested delivery of proxy materials electronically.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have chosen to employ this distribution process to conserve natural resources and reduce the costs of printing and distributing our proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders of record at the close of business on January 9, 2017 are entitled to vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important no matter how many shares you own.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether you expect to attend the meeting or not, please vote your shares by using the Internet as described in the instructions included on your Notice, by calling the toll-free telephone number, or, if you received a paper copy of the proxy materials, by completing, signing, dating and returning your proxy card or voting instruction form.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your prompt response is necessary to ensure that your shares are represented at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can change your vote and revoke your proxy at any time before the polls close at the meeting by following the procedures described in the accompanying proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shareholders are cordially invited to attend the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By order of the Board of Directors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MARGARET K. SEIF Secretary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Norwood, Massachusetts January 25, 2017

sentences.text: 2016 Business Results
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our fiscal year ended October 29, 2016, or fiscal 2016, was a year of strong execution for Analog Devices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our business model generated gross margins of 65.1%, operating margins of 30.0%, operating cash flow of approximately $1.3 billion, or 37.4% of revenue and free cash flow of approximately $1.2 billion, or 33.7% of revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also returned approximately $883 million to shareholders in the form of dividends and share repurchases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to strong business results, in fiscal 2016, we announced the proposed acquisition of Linear Technology Corporation, which once complete, will create a high-performance analog leader, with the combined company having a top two market share position across all the key building blocks of the analog market, namely: data converters, power management, amplifiers, interface, and high-performance RF and microwave.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the most comparable GAAP financial measure.

sentences.text: Data based on Gartner reports and Company estimates based on Fiscal 2015 data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RF/Microwave is based on Company estimates and excludes consumer and cellular infrastructure power amplifiers.

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Philosophy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Executive Compensation Program is designed to attract, motivate and retain top executive talent and align the interests of our executives and our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We accomplish this through the following steps:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. First, we ensure our executive compensation is competitive and attracts and retains top executive talent by understanding how the total target compensation (consisting of salary, bonus and equity awards) of our named executive officers, or NEOs, is benchmarked against the median total target compensation of those in similar positions within our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. We then consider a variety of factors, including the scope of the role and the performance and experience of the individual when deciding how each NEOs total target compensation compares to the median total target compensation of those in similar positions within our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. We structure our compensation package to align executives interests with those of our shareholders by tying a significant portion of their total compensation directly to ADIs short- and long-term performance, measured by operating profit before taxes as a percentage of revenue, or OPBT margin and year-over-year revenue growth, which both drive shareholder value, stock price appreciation and relative total shareholder return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A significant portion of our NEOs total compensation is variable and directly linked to Company performance in the form of variable cash incentive bonus payments and equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This approach provides our executives with an opportunity to earn above peer average compensation if ADI delivers strong results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similarly, our NEOs total compensation is suppressed if our business results are below target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We compensate our executives using the following elements:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Element    Objective    Fixed/Variable   Base Salary    Attract and retain talent and provide stable source of income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fixed Cash Incentive Bonus Award    Link pay and annual Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Align executive compensation with the financial performance of the Company and our achievement of Company goals relating to OPBT margin and year-over-year revenue growth, which are measured quarterly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variable Long-Term Equity Compensation    Link pay and long-term Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reward stock price appreciation, promote long-term retention and permit executives to accumulate equity ownership in the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variable Retirement and Other Employee Benefits    Retain talent by providing financial protection and security.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fixed
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Compensation Actions for 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, ADIs Compensation Committee reviews our executive compensation programs components, targets and payouts to ensure that our pay practices remain competitive and aligned with our performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our performance is evaluated against short- and long-term goals that support our business strategy and the creation of sustainable long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These items are described in more detail beginning on page 33 of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to our 2016 executive compensation program, we maintained challenging financial performance objectives for our variable cash incentive bonus plan based on our achievement of operating profit before taxes as a percentage of revenue, or OPBT margin and year-over-year revenue growth, which are measured quarterly and paid to executives and employees semi-annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These financial performance objectives for our variable cash incentive bonus plan are established at the beginning of our fiscal year and align with our annual operating, financial and strategic objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our equity program is comprised of performance-based restricted stock units, time-based restricted stock units and stock options, which together are designed to align the executives interests with our and our shareholders goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay and Governance Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our pay and governance practices are designed to align our executives interests with our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not pay dividends on unvested equity awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We prohibit hedging transactions and short sales involving ADI securities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide extensive perquisites to our executives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We prohibit holding ADI securities in margin accounts
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our cash incentive bonus awards are based solely on our financial performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our equity grant date policy does not give executives or directors discretion to choose grant dates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We prohibit pledging ADI securities as collateral for a loan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not modify our performance targets during the year, even in challenging years
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have stock ownership guidelines for all officers and directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide tax gross-ups for new executive officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Say on Pay and Shareholder Engagement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, Analog Devices again received strong support for our executive compensation program with approximately 98.4% of votes cast approving our advisory say on pay resolution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We pay careful attention to feedback that we receive from our shareholders about our executive compensation program, including the say on pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the course of the year, we held in-person and telephonic meetings with a number of shareholders to discuss a variety of matters, including our executive compensation program and how they evaluate it.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee carefully considers this feedback when making decisions regarding executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please see the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section beginning on page 33 of this proxy statement for a more detailed description of our executive compensation program, philosophy and design.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is the purpose of the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Annual Meeting, shareholders will consider and vote on the following matters:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. The election of the nine nominees named in this proxy statement to our Board of Directors, each for a term expiring at the next annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. The approval, by non-binding say on pay vote, of the compensation of our named executive officers, as described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, executive compensation tables and accompanying narrative disclosures in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. To hold a non-binding say on frequency vote, regarding the frequency of future advisory votes on the compensation of our named executive officers (every year, every two years or every three years).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. The ratification of the selection of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending October 28, 2017, or 2017 fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The shareholders will also act on any other business that may properly come before the meeting or any postponement, adjournment, rescheduling or continuation of the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who can vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be able to vote, you must have been an Analog Devices shareholder of record at the close of business on January 9, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This date is the record date for the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of outstanding shares entitled to vote on each proposal at the Annual Meeting is 309,077,439 shares of our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How many votes do I have?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each share of our common stock that you own on the record date entitles you to one vote on each matter that is voted on.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Is my vote important?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Yes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important no matter how many shares you own.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please take the time to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Take a moment to read the instructions below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Choose the way to vote that is easiest and most convenient for you and cast your vote as soon as possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do I vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are the record holder of your shares, meaning that you own your shares in your own name and not through a bank, broker or other nominee, you may vote in one of four ways.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) You may vote over the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you have Internet access, you may vote your shares from any location in the world by following the Internet voting instructions on the Notice or the proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) You may vote by telephone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote your shares by following the telephone voting instructions on the Notice or the proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) You may vote by mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received a printed proxy card, you may vote by completing and signing the proxy card and promptly mailing it in the enclosed postage-prepaid envelope.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You do not need to put a stamp on the enclosed envelope if you mail it in the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The shares you own will be voted according to your instructions on the proxy card that you mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you return the proxy card, but do not give any instructions on a particular matter described in this proxy statement, the shares you own will be voted in accordance with the recommendations of our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR Proposals 1, 2 and 4 and for EVERY YEAR on Proposal 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4) You may vote in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you attend the Annual Meeting, you may vote by delivering your completed proxy card in person or by completing a ballot.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ballots will be available at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please note that you cannot vote by marking up the Notice of Internet Availability of the Proxy Materials and mailing the Notice back.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any votes returned in that manner will not be counted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Can I vote if my shares are held in street name?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Analog Devices shares that you own are held in street name by a bank, broker or other nominee, your bank, broker or other nominee is considered, with respect to those shares, the record holder of your shares, and is required to vote your shares according to your instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to vote your shares, you will need to follow the instructions that your bank, broker or other nominee provides you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Many banks, brokers or other nominees also offer the option of voting over the Internet or by telephone, instructions for which would be provided by your bank, broker or other nominee on your vote instruction form.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold shares through an account with a broker, the voting of shares by such broker when you do not provide voting instructions is governed by applicable stock exchange rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These rules allow brokers to vote shares at their discretion on routine matters for which their customers do not provide voting instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On matters that are considered non-routine, brokers may not vote shares without your instruction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ratification of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm (Proposal 4) is considered a routine matter and your broker will be able to vote on that proposal even if it does not receive instructions from you, so long as it holds your shares in its name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The election of directors (Proposal 1) and the say on pay and the say on frequency advisory votes (Proposals 2 and 3) are non-routine matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not instruct your bank, broker or other nominee how to vote with respect to these proposals, your bank, broker or other nominee may not vote with respect to these proposals and those votes will be counted as broker non-votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes are shares that are held in street name by a bank, broker or other nominee that indicates on its proxy that it does not have or did not exercise discretionary authority to vote on a particular proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in street name, you must bring an account statement or letter from your broker or other nominee, showing that you are the beneficial owner of the shares as of the record date (January 9, 2017) in order to be admitted to the Annual Meeting on March 8, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be able to vote your shares held in street name at the Annual Meeting, you will need to obtain a legal proxy from your bank, broker or other nominee, issued in your name giving you the right to vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Can I change my vote after I have mailed my proxy card or after I have voted my shares over the Internet or by teleph
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Yes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are the record holder of your shares, you can revoke your proxy or change your vote at any time before the polls lose at the Annual Meeting by doing any one of the following things:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: voting over the Internet or by telephone as instructed above (only your latest Internet or telephone vote is counted)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: signing and returning another proxy card with a later date;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: giving our Secretary a written notice before or at the meeting that you want to revoke your proxy; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: attending the Annual Meeting, requesting that your proxy be revoked and voting in person as instructed above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your attendance at the meeting alone will not revoke your proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in street name, you may submit a new, later-dated vote instruction form or contact your bank, broker or other nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may also vote in person at the Annual Meeting if you obtain a legal proxy as described in the answer to the question above entitled Can I vote if my shares are held in street name?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do I vote my shares held in trust in the Analog Ireland Success Sharing Share Plan?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you participate in the Analog Ireland Success Sharing Share Plan, which we refer to as the Ireland share plan, you may instruct Irish Pensions Trust Limited, which serves as the trustee of the Ireland share plan, to vote the amount of shares of common stock that they hold on your behalf as of the record date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will receive a voting card that you may use to direct Mercer Ireland Limited, or Mercer, which administers the Irish share plan on behalf of Irish Pensions Trust Limited, how to vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You should sign the voting card and return it to Mercer in the envelope provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mercer will vote the shares in the manner that you direct on the voting card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If Mercer does not receive your voting card by 5:00 p.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) on March 1, 2017, Mercer will not vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What constitutes a quorum?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order for business to be conducted at the Annual Meeting, a quorum must be present in person or represented by valid proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each of the proposals to be presented at the Annual Meeting, a quorum consists of the holders of a majority of the shares of common stock issued and outstanding on January 9, 2017, the record date, or at least 154,538,720 shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares of common stock represented in person or by proxy (including broker non-votes and shares that abstain or do not vote with respect to a particular proposal) will be counted for the purpose of determining whether a quorum exists at the Annual Meeting for that proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a quorum is not present, the Annual Meeting will be adjourned until a quorum is obtained.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What vote is required for each proposal?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Election of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our bylaws, a nominee will be elected to the Board of Directors if the votes cast for the nominees election exceed the votes cast against the nominees election, with abstentions and broker non-votes not counting as votes for or against.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the shares you own are held in street name by a bank, broker or other nominee, your bank, broker or other nominee, as the record holder of your shares, is required to vote your shares according to your instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not instruct your bank, broker or other nominee how to vote with respect to this proposal, your bank, broker or other nominee may not vote your shares with respect to the election of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an incumbent director nominee in an uncontested election of directors receives a majority of votes against his election, the director must tender a resignation from the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors will then decide whether to accept the resignation within 90 days following certification of the shareholder vote (based on the recommendation of a committee of independent directors).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will publicly disclose the Board of Directors decision and its reasoning with regard to the offered resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Say on Pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors is seeking a non-binding advisory vote regarding the compensation of our named executive officers, as described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, executive compensation tables and accompanying narrative disclosures contained in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our bylaws, the affirmative vote of a majority of the total number of votes cast on the proposal is needed to approve this resolution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vote is advisory and non-binding in nature but our Compensation Committee will take into account the outcome of the vote when considering future executive compensation arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not instruct your bank, broker or other nominee how to vote with respect to this proposal, your bank, broker or other nominee may not vote your shares with respect to this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Say on Frequency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors is seeking a non-binding advisory vote regarding whether shareholders prefer to hold an advisory vote on the compensation program of our named executive officers once every year, once every two years or once every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2011, our shareholders voted to hold this vote annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vote is advisory and non-binding in nature, but our Board of Directors has decided to adopt the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: frequency that receives the greatest level of support from our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not instruct your bank, broker or other nominee how to vote with respect to this item, your bank, broker or other nominee may not vote with respect to this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ratification of independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our bylaws, the affirmative vote of a majority of the total number of votes cast on the proposal is needed to ratify the selection of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the 2017 fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if you do not instruct your bank, broker or other nominee how to vote with respect to this proposal, your bank, broker or other nominee may vote your shares with respect to this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How will votes be counted?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each share of common stock will be counted as one vote according to the instructions contained on a properly completed proxy card, whether submitted in person, by mail, over the Internet or by telephone, or on a ballot voted in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to all proposals, shares will not be voted in favor of the matter, and will not be counted as voting on the matter, if they either (1) abstain from voting on a particular matter, or (2) are broker non-votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Banks, brokers and other nominees who do not receive instructions with respect to Proposals 1, 2 or 3 will not be allowed to vote these shares, and all such shares will be broker non-votes rather than votes for or against.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, assuming the presence of a quorum, abstentions and broker non-votes for a particular proposal will not be counted as votes cast to determine the outcome of a particular proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who will count the votes?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The votes will be counted, tabulated and certified by Broadridge.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Will my vote be kept confidential?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Yes, your vote will be kept confidential and we will not disclose your vote, unless (1) we are required to do so by law (including in connection with the pursuit or defense of a legal or administrative action or proceeding), or (2) there is a contested election for the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The tabulation agent will forward any written comments that you make on the proxy card to management without providing your name, unless you expressly request disclosure on your proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How does the Board of Directors recommend that I vote on the proposals?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends that you vote:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the election of each of the nine nominees to serve as directors on the Board of Directors, each for a term expiring at the next annual meeting of shareholders (Proposal 1);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the approval, by non-binding say on pay vote, of the compensation of our named executive officers, as described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, executive compensation tables and accompanying narrative disclosures contained in this proxy statement (Proposal 2);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR an advisory vote EVERY YEAR on the compensation of our named executive officers, consistent with our practice over the last six years (Proposal 3); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the ratification of the selection of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the 2017 fiscal year (Proposal 4).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Will any other matters be voted on at this meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the laws of Massachusetts, where we are incorporated, an item may not be brought before our shareholders at a meeting unless it appears in the notice of the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our bylaws establish the process for a shareholder to bring a matter before a meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See How and when may I submit a shareholder proposal, including a shareholder nomination for director, for the 2018 annual meeting of shareholders?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Where can I find the voting results?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will report the voting results in a Form 8-K filed with the SEC within four business days after the end of the Annual Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How and when may I submit a shareholder proposal, including a shareholder nomination for director, for the 2018 annual meeting of shareholders?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are interested in submitting a proposal for inclusion in our proxy statement for the 2018 annual meeting, you need to follow the procedures outlined in Rule 14a-8 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, or the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be eligible for inclusion, we must receive your shareholder proposal for our proxy statement for the 2018 annual meeting of shareholders at our principal corporate offices in Norwood, Massachusetts at the address below no later than September 27, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our bylaws require that we be given advance written notice for nominations for election to our Board of Directors and other matters that shareholders wish to present for action at an annual meeting other than those to be included in our proxy statement under Rule 14a-8.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Secretary must receive such notice at the address noted below not less than 90 days or more than 120 days before the first anniversary of the preceding years annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if the date of our annual meeting is advanced by more than 20 days, or delayed by more than 60 days, from the anniversary date, then we must receive such notice at the address noted below not earlier than the 120th day before such annual meeting and not later than the close of business on the later of (1) the 90th day before such annual meeting or (2) the seventh day after the day on which notice of the meeting date was mailed or public disclosure was made, whichever occurs first.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assuming that the 2018 annual meeting is not advanced by more than 20 days nor delayed by more than 60 days from the anniversary date of the 2017 annual meeting, you would need to give us appropriate notice at the address noted below no earlier than November 8, 2017, and no later than December 8, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a shareholder does not provide timely notice of a nomination or other matter to be presented at the 2018 annual meeting, under Massachusetts law, it may not be brought before our shareholders at a meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our bylaws also specify requirements relating to the content of the notice that shareholders must provide to the Secretary of Analog Devices for any matter, including a shareholder proposal or nomination for director, to be properly presented at a shareholder meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of the full text of our bylaws is on file with the SEC and publicly available on our website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any proposals, nominations or notices should be sent to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Margaret K. Seif, Secretary Analog Devices, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One Technology Way Norwood, Massachusetts 02062 Phone: 781-461-3367 Fax: 781-461-3491 Email: margaret.seif@analog.com
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What are the costs of soliciting these proxies and who will pay?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will bear the costs of solicitation of proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have engaged Alliance Advisors LLC to assist us with the solicitation of proxies and expect to pay Alliance Advisors approximately $11,500 for their services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: addition to solicitations by mail, Alliance Advisors and our directors, officers and regular employees may solicit proxies by telephone, email and personal interviews without additional remuneration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will request brokers, custodians and fiduciaries to forward proxy soliciting material to the owners of shares of our common stock that they hold in their names.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will reimburse banks and brokers for their reasonable out-of-pocket expenses incurred in connection with the distribution of our proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why did I receive a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials but no proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This year we are distributing our proxy materials to stockholders via the Internet under the Notice and Access approach permitted by the rules of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, or SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This approach expedites stockholders receipt of proxy materials while conserving natural resources and reducing our distribution costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On or about January 25, 2017, we mailed a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials containing instructions on how to access the proxy materials on the Internet to participating stockholders, and if desired, to request to receive a paper copy of our proxy materials by mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How can I obtain an Annual Report on Form 10-K?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended October 29, 2016, or fiscal 2016, is available on our website at www.analog.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you would like a copy of our Annual Report on Form 10-K for fiscal 2016 and/or any of its exhibits, we will send you such materials without charge.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please contact:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director of Investor Relations Analog Devices, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One Technology Way Norwood, Massachusetts 02062 Phone: 781-461-3282 Email: investor.relations@analog.com
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whom should I contact if I have any questions?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you have any questions about the Annual Meeting or your ownership of our common stock, please contact our Director of Investor Relations, at the address, telephone number or email address listed above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOUSEHOLDING OF ANNUAL MEETING MATERIALS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some banks, brokers and other nominee record holders may be participating in the practice of householding proxy statements and annual reports.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that only one copy of our proxy statement and annual report to shareholders may have been sent to multiple shareholders in your household unless we have received contrary instructions from one or more shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will promptly deliver a separate copy of either document to you if you contact us at the following address, telephone number or email address: Director of Investor Relations, Analog Devices, Inc., One Technology Way, Norwood, Massachusetts 02062, telephone: 781-461-3282, email: investor.relations@analog.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you want to receive separate copies of the proxy statement or annual report to shareholders in the future, or if you are receiving multiple copies and would like to receive only one copy per household, you should contact your bank, broker, or other nominee record holder, or you may contact us at the above address, telephone number or email address.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) of the Exchange Act requires our executive officers, directors and the holders of more than 10% of our common stock to file with the SEC initial reports of ownership of our common stock and other equity securities on a Form 3 and reports of changes in such ownership on a Form 4 or Form 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Officers, directors and 10% shareholders are required by SEC regulations to furnish us with copies of all Section 16(a) forms they file.

sentences.text: To our knowledge, based solely on a review of our records and written representations by the persons required to file these reports, all filing requirements of Section 16(a) were satisfied with respect to our most recent fiscal year or prior fiscal years, with the exception of one Form 4 reporting the grant of a stock option, the grant of performance-based restricted units and the grant of time-based restricted stock units to Mr. Roche, which was filed on March 15, 2016, 4 days after its due date of March 11, 2016, two Forms 4 reporting the purchase of an aggregate of 218 shares of common stock by Mr. Real indirectly through the Companys Ireland Success Sharing Share Plan on June 4, 2015 and December 3, 2015, which were reported on December 7, 2016 and one Form 4 reporting the sale of 1,600 shares of common stock by Mr. Hodgson on March 18, 2015, which was reported January 13, 2017.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Election Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our entire Board of Directors is elected annually by our shareholders and currently consists of eleven directors, of whom nine are deemed to be independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Richard M. Beyer and John C. Hodgson are retiring from the Board of Directors and therefore are not standing for re-election at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Beyer and Hodgson will each continue to serve as a director until his term expires at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On January 18, 2017, we announced that our Board of Directors intends to elect Mr. Robert Swanson, Executive Chairman of Linear Technology Corporation (Linear), to our Board of Directors at the later of the completion of the acquisition of Linear or the Board of Directors meeting following the Companys 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, for a term expiring at our 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Annual Meeting, shareholders will accordingly have an opportunity to vote for each of the nine nominees listed below, of whom seven are deemed to be independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The persons named in the enclosed proxy card, upon receipt of a properly executed proxy, will vote for each of these nominees, unless you instruct them to vote otherwise on the proxy card (whether executed by you or through Internet or telephonic voting).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the nominees has indicated his or her willingness to serve, if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if any or all of the nominees should be unable or unwilling to serve, the proxies may be voted for a substitute nominee designated by our Board of Directors or our Board of Directors may reduce the number of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Criteria, Qualifications and Experience
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors is committed to ensuring that it is composed of a highly capable group of directors who collectively provide a significant breadth of experience, knowledge and abilities, to effectively represent the interests of shareholders and reflect our corporate values of integrity, honesty and adherence to high ethical standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key factors that the Board of Directors and the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee consider when selecting directors include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Experience and Strong Business Acumen  The Board strives for its members to span a range of leadership skills and represent a broad breadth of experience relevant to the Companys strategic vision and business activities, as well as the ability to exercise sound judgment in matters that relate to the current and long-term objectives of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tenure  The Board believes that having directors with a mix of tenure on the Board helps transition the knowledge of the more experienced directors while providing a broad, fresh set of perspectives and provides the Board with a diversity of experiences and viewpoints.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The average tenure of our independent directors standing for re-election is approximately 5.9 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Diversity  While the Board does not have a specific diversity policy, our Corporate Governance Guidelines provide that gender, racial and ethnic diversity, consistent with the requirement for relevant and diverse experience, skills and industry familiarity, are important search criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following paragraphs provide information as of the date of this proxy statement about each nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The information presented includes information each director has given us about his or her age, all positions he or she holds, his or her principal occupation and business experience, and the names of other publicly-held companies of which he or she currently serves as a director or has served as a director during the past five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the information presented below regarding each nominees specific experience, qualifications, attributes and skills that led our Board of Directors to the conclusion that he or she should serve as a director, we also believe that all of our director nominees have a reputation for integrity, honesty and adherence to high ethical standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They each have demonstrated business acumen and an ability to exercise sound judgment, as well as a commitment of service to ADI and our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, we value their significant experience on other public company boards of directors and board committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information about the number of shares of common stock beneficially owned by each director appears above under the heading Security Ownership of Certain Beneficial Owners and Management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See also Certain Relationships and Related Transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are no family relationships among any of the directors and executive officers of ADI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RAY STATA, Chairman of the Board of Directors; Director since 1965
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Stata, age 82, has served as our Chairman of the Board of Directors since 1973 and served as an executive officer of our Company from its inception until April 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Stata served as our Chief Executive Officer from 1973 to November 1996 and as our President from 1971 to November 1991.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe Mr. Statas qualifications to serve on our Board of Directors include more than 50 years of experience and leadership in the semiconductor industry, including as our founder, our Chairman for 43 years and formerly as our President for 20 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If re-elected, Mr. Stata will continue to serve as our Chairman of the Board of Directors in 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: VINCENT ROCHE, President and Chief Executive Officer; Director since 2013
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Roche, age 56, was appointed our Chief Executive Officer and elected as a Director in May 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Roche was appointed President of Analog Devices in 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Roche also served as our Vice President, Strategic Segments Group and Global Sales from October 2009 to November 2012, and as our Vice President, Worldwide Sales from March 2001 to October 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Roche began his career at ADI in 1988 as a senior marketing engineer, and he has served in key leadership positions over his 29-year tenure at ADI, including worldwide sales, strategic marketing, business development and product management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Roche also serves as a director of Acacia Communications, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that Mr. Roches qualifications to serve on the Board of Directors include his leadership role in the Company and his deep knowledge of the Companys products, markets and customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: JAMES A. CHAMPY, Director since 2003
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Champy, age 74, retired in 2010 as Vice President of the Dell/Perot Systems business unit of Dell, Inc., a computer and technology services company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was previously a Vice President and the Chairman of Consulting at Perot Systems Corporation from 1996 to November 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served as a director of Perot Systems Corporation from 1996 to 2004.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Champy is the author of several business books and is a Life Member of the MIT Corporation, the governing body of the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe Mr. Champys qualifications to serve on our Board of Directors include his expertise in corporate strategy development and his organizational acumen.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BRUCE R. EVANS, Director since June 2015
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Evans, age 57, has served in various positions with Summit Partners, a growth equity, venture capital and credit investment firm, including most recently as a Managing Director, since 1986.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He has also served as Chairman of Summit Partners board since 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During his time at Summit Partners, Mr. Evans has served as a member of the boards of directors of over 30 technology and other growth industry companies in the US and Europe, including 12 public companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Evans is a member and Chairman Elect of the Vanderbilt University Board of Trust and the Chairman of Vanderbilts Investment Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served as a director of FleetCor Technologies, Inc. from 2002 until 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe Mr. Evans qualifications to serve on our Board include his financial and management expertise, including his investing experience in the technology sector and his experience with acquisitions and other transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EDWARD H. FRANK, Director since 2014
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Frank, age 60, is co-founder and Chief Executive Officer of Cloud Parity, an early-stage voice of the customer startup.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Before founding Cloud Parity in 2014, Dr. Frank held the position of Vice President, Macintosh Hardware Systems Engineering at Apple, Inc., a company that designs, manufactures and markets
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: electronic devices, from 2009 to 2013.

sentences.text: Prior to his tenure at Apple, Dr. Frank served as Corporate Vice President, Research and Development, of Broadcom Corp.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Frank was founding CEO of Epigram, Inc., a developer of integrated circuits and software for home networking, which Broadcom acquired in 1999, and was a Distinguished Engineer at Sun Microsystems, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Frank also serves as a director of Cavium, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served as a director of Fusion-IO, Inc. from 2013 until July 2014 when it was acquired by SanDisk Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe Dr. Franks qualifications to serve on our Board of Directors include his deep understanding of the communications and hardware technology markets and his extensive executive leadership experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MARK M. LITTLE, Director since January 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Little, age 64, is the former Senior Vice President, GE Global Research and Chief Technology Officer of General Electric Company, or GE, a global digital industrial company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Little joined GE in 1978, and during his 37-year tenure, held management positions in engineering and business, culminating with his most recent position, which he held from 2005 until 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to his technology leadership, Dr. Little led several multi-billion dollar business units at GE including GE Energys power-generation segment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe Dr. Littles qualifications to serve on our Board of Directors include his extensive leadership experience in a global technology company, combined with his experience driving change and innovation through GEs various phases of business transformation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEIL NOVICH, Director since 2008
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Novich, age 62, is the former Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer of Ryerson Inc., a global metals distributor and fabricator.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He joined Ryerson in 1994 as Chief Operating Officer and served in that role until 1999 when he was named Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer, a position he held through 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to that, he was a Director at Bain & Company, an international consulting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Novich also serves as a director of W.W. Grainger, Inc., Hillenbrand Inc. and Beacon Roofing Supply, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe Mr. Novichs qualifications to serve on our Board of Directors include his experience as a chief executive officer leading a complex global organization, combined with his broad operational and corporate governance expertise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KENTON J. SICCHITANO, Director since 2003
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Sicchitano, age 72, retired from PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, or PwC, a public accounting firm, in July 2001.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the time of his retirement, Mr. Sicchitano was the Global Managing Partner of Independence and Regulatory Matters for PwC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Sicchitano joined Price Waterhouse LLP, a predecessor firm of PwC, in 1970 and became a partner in 1979.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During his 31-year tenure with PwC, Mr. Sicchitano held various positions including the Global Managing Partner of Audit/Business Advisory Services and the Global Managing Partner responsible for Audit/Business Advisory, Tax and Financial Advisory Services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Sicchitano also serves as a director of PerkinElmer, Inc. and MetLife, Inc. and its wholly owned subsidiary, Metropolitan Life Insurance Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe Mr. Sicchitanos qualifications to sit on our Board of Directors include his extensive experience with public and financial accounting matters for complex global organizations.

sentences.text: Previously she served at AMD as Senior Vice President and Chief Operating Officer from July 2014 to October 2014 and Senior Vice President and General Manager, Global Business Units from January 2012 to July 2014.

sentences.text: and Device Center.

sentences.text: Dr. Su also serves as a director of AMD.

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have long believed that good corporate governance is important to ensure that Analog Devices is managed for the long-term benefit of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We periodically review our corporate governance policies and practices and compare them to those suggested by various authorities in corporate governance and the practices of other public companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, we have adopted policies and procedures that we believe are in the best interests of Analog Devices and our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, we have adopted the following policies and procedures:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has adopted Corporate Governance Guidelines for our Company that establishes a common set of expectations to assist the Board and its committees in performing their duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board reviews these Guidelines at least annually, and updates them as necessary to reflect changing regulatory requirements and evolving practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Declassified Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a declassified Board of Directors and our bylaws provide that each director will serve for a term ending on the date of the annual meeting following the one at which such director was elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our directors will stand for election for terms expiring at the next annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Majority Voting for Election of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our bylaws provide for a majority voting standard in uncontested director elections, so a nominee is elected to the Board of Directors if the votes for that director exceed the votes against (with abstentions and broker non-votes not counted as for or against the election).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a nominee does not receive more for votes than against votes, the director must offer his or her resignation, which the Board of Directors must determine whether to accept and publicly disclose that determination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Sessions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At each regular meeting, our Board of Directors holds executive sessions of non-employee directors, who are all independent as defined under The NASDAQ Stock Market, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Marketplace Rules, or the NASDAQ Rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our lead director, James A. Champy, presides at these executive sessions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the committees of our Board of Directors also regularly hold executive sessions with their advisors without management present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Hedging Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We prohibit all hedging transactions or short sales involving Company securities by our directors and employees, including our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Pledging Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since January 2013, we have prohibited our directors and executive officers from holding any Company securities in a margin account, and from any future pledging of their Company securities as collateral for a loan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Award Grant Date Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not time or select the grant dates of any stock options or stock-based awards in coordination with our release of material non-public information, nor do we have any program, plan or practice to do so.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Compensation Committee has adopted specific written policies regarding the grant dates of stock option and stock-based awards made to our directors, executive officers and employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See  Director Compensation and INFORMATION ABOUT EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION  Compensation Discussion and Analysis  Equity Award Grant Date Policy below for more information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can access the current charters for our Audit Committee, Compensation Committee and Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, our Corporate Governance Guidelines, our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics and our Equity Award Grant Date Policy at investor.analog.com/corporate-governance.cfm or by writing to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director of Investor Relations Analog Devices, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One Technology Way Norwood, Massachusetts 02062 Phone: 781-461-3282 Fax: 781-461-3491 Email: investor.relations@analog.co
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Determination of Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under applicable NASDAQ Rules, a director of Analog Devices will only qualify as an independent director if, in the opinion of our Board of Directors, that person does not have a relationship which would interfere with the exercise of independent judgment in carrying out the responsibilities of a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has established guidelines (within our Corporate Governance Guidelines) to assist it in determining whether a director has a relationship with Analog Devices that would interfere with the exercise of independent judgment in carrying out the responsibilities of a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These guidelines are posted on our website under investor.analog.com/corporate-governance.cfm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For relationships not covered by the guidelines, the determination of whether such a relationship exists is made by the members of our Board of Directors who are independent (as defined above).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has determined that none of Messrs. Beyer, Champy, Evans, Hodgson, Novich and Sicchitano and Drs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Frank, Little and Su has a relationship which would interfere with the exercise of independent judgment in carrying out the responsibilities of a director and that each of these directors is an independent director as defined under Rule 5605(a)(2) of the NASDAQ Rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also determined that Yves-Andre Istel, a former director, was an independent director prior to his resignation from the Board on March 9, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that Mr. Roche, our President and Chief Executive Officer, and Mr. Stata, our Chairman and founder, are not independent under the NASDAQ Rules because Mr. Roche is a current employee and Mr. Stata is our founder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We considered the Companys annual laboratory membership and university research projects with MIT (of which James A. Champy is a board member) and the Companys annual membership to the Semiconductor Industry Association, or the SIA, (of which Vincent Roche and Lisa Su are board members) and determined that the relationships were established in the ordinary course of business on an arms-length basis without the involvement of Messrs. Champy or Mr. Roche or Dr. Su, and are not material to MIT, the SIA or the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Candidates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders of record of Analog Devices may recommend director candidates for inclusion by the Board of Directors in the slate of nominees that the Board of Directors recommends to our shareholders for election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The qualifications of recommended candidates will be reviewed by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Board of Directors determines to nominate a shareholder-recommended candidate and recommends his or her election as a director by the shareholders, the name will be included in Analog Devices proxy card for the shareholders meeting at which his or her election is recommended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may recommend individuals for the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee to consider as potential director candidates by submitting their names and background and a statement as to whether the shareholder or group of shareholders making the recommendation has beneficially owned more than 5% of Analog Devices common stock for at least one year as of the date the recommendation is made, to the Analog Devices Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, c/o Margaret K. Seif, Secretary, Analog Devices, Inc., One Technology Way, Norwood, Massachusetts 02062.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee will consider a recommendation only if appropriate biographical information and background material is provided on a timely basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The process followed by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee to identify and evaluate candidates includes requests to Board members and others for recommendations, input from director search firms for identification and evaluation of candidates, meetings from time to time to evaluate biographical information and background material relating to potential candidates and interviews of selected candidates by members of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee and the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assuming that appropriate biographical and background material is provided for candidates recommended by shareholders on a timely basis, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee will evaluate director candidates recommended by shareholders by following substantially the same process, and applying substantially the same criteria, as it follows for director candidates submitted by Board members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders also have the right to directly nominate director candidates, without any action or recommendation on the part of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee or the Board of Directors, by following the procedures set forth in ADIs amended and restated bylaws and described in the response to the question How and when may I submit a shareholder proposal, including a shareholder nomination for director, for the 2018 annual meeting of shareholders?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In considering whether to recommend any candidate for inclusion in the Board of Directors slate of recommended director nominees, including candidates recommended by shareholders, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee will apply the criteria set forth in our Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These criteria include the candidates integrity, business acumen, experience, commitment, and diligence, the presence of any conflicts of interest and the ability of the candidate to act in the interests of all shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee seeks nominees with a broad diversity of experience, professions, skills, geographic representation and backgrounds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee does not assign specific weights to particular criteria and no particular criterion is necessarily applicable to all prospective nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Analog Devices believes that the backgrounds and qualifications of the directors, considered as a group, should provide a significant composite mix of experience, knowledge and abilities that will allow the Board of Directors to fulfill its responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While we do not have a policy regarding Board diversity, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee includes gender, racial and ethnic diversity as part of its search criteria, consistent with the requirement for relevant and diverse experience, skills and industry familiarity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communications from Shareholders and Other Interested Parties
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors will give appropriate attention to written communications on issues that are submitted by shareholders and other interested parties, and will respond if and as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Absent unusual circumstances or as contemplated by committee charters, the Chairman of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee will, with the assistance of Analog Devices internal legal counsel, (1) be primarily responsible for monitoring communications from shareholders and other interested parties and (2) provide copies or summaries of such communications to the other directors as he considers appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communications will be forwarded to all directors if they relate to substantive matters and include suggestions or comments that the Chairman of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee considers to be important for the directors to review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, communications relating to corporate governance and long-term corporate strategy are more likely to be forwarded than communications relating to personal grievances, commercial solicitations, and matters as to which Analog Devices tends to receive repetitive or duplicative communications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders and other interested parties who wish to send communications on any topic to the Board of Directors (including the presiding director or the independent directors as a group) should address such
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: communications to James A. Champy, Presiding Director, c/o Secretary, Analog Devices, Inc., One Technology Way, Norwood, Massachusetts 02062.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board of Directors Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines provide that the roles of Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of the Board of Directors should be separate, unless otherwise determined by a majority of the Board of Directors, and we currently separate these roles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Chief Executive Officer is responsible for setting the strategic direction for the Company and the day-to-day leadership and performance of the Company, while our Chairman of the Board of Directors provides guidance to the Chief Executive Officer, sets the agenda for Board meetings and presides over meetings of the full Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because our Board of Directors has determined that Mr. Stata, our Chairman and founder, is not an independent director under the NASDAQ Rules, our Board of Directors has appointed James A. Champy as presiding director to preside at all executive sessions of independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors meets in executive session at each regular meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board of Directors Meetings and Committees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has responsibility for reviewing our overall performance, rather than day-to-day operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors primary responsibility is to oversee the management of the Company and, in so doing, serve the best interests of the Company and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors provides for the succession of the Chief Executive Officer, nominates for election at annual shareholder meetings individuals to serve as directors of Analog Devices, and elects individuals to fill any vacancies on the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It reviews corporate objectives and strategies, and evaluates and approves significant policies and proposed major commitments of corporate resources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It participates in decisions that have a potential major economic impact on Analog Devices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management keeps the directors informed of Company activity through regular written reports and presentations at Board and committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors met 12 times in fiscal 2016 (including by telephone conference).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal 2016, each of our directors attended 75% or more of the total number of meetings of the Board of Directors and the committees on which he or she served.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has standing Audit, Compensation, and Nominating and Corporate Governance Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All members of all three committees are independent, non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each committee has a charter that has been approved by the Board of Directors and is reviewed annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each Committee conducts an annual self-evaluation of its own performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Roche is the only director who is, or has been in the past three years, an employee of Analog Devices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Roche and Stata do not serve on any standing Board committee and do not participate in the portion of any Board or committee meeting during which their compensation is evaluated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent directors met in executive session without Mr. Stata or our Chief Executive Officer at each in-person Board meeting in fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines set forth our policy that directors are expected to attend annual meetings of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our then-serving directors attended the 2016 Annual Meeting of Shareholders.

Sicchitano, Evans, Little and Hodgson qualifies as an audit committee financial expert under the rules of the SEC and is independent as defined under the NASDAQ Rules and the independence requirements under Rule 10A-3(b)(1) of the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our Board of Directors has determined that each member of the Audit Committee is able to read and understand financial statements, including the Companys consolidated balance sheet and its consolidated statements of income, comprehensive income, shareholders equity and cash flows and related notes as required under the NASDAQ Rules.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: employment experience in finance or accounting as required by the NASDAQ Rules.

sentences.text: None of Messrs. Sicchitano, Evans, Little or Hodgson serves on the audit committees of more than two other public companies.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the integrity of our financial statements and the Companys systems of internal control over financial reporting and disclosure controls and procedures,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the qualifications and independence of our independent registered public accounting firm, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
