sentences.text: Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current members of our Compensation Committee are Messrs. Novich (Chair) and Beyer and Dr. Su.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has determined that each of Messrs. Novich and Beyer and Dr. Su is independent as defined under the NASDAQ Rules and the independence requirements under Rule 10C-1 of the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee evaluates and sets the compensation of our Chief Executive Officer and our other executive officers, and makes recommendations to our Board of Directors regarding the compensation of our directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee oversees the evaluation of senior management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with its oversight and administration of ADIs cash and equity incentive plans, the Compensation Committee authorizes the granting of stock options, RSUs and other stock incentives (within guidelines established by our Board of Directors and in accordance with our equity granting policy) to our officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the terms of our Amended and Restated 2006 Stock Incentive Plan, which we refer to as the 2006 Stock Incentive Plan, the Compensation Committee has delegated to our Chief Executive Officer the power to grant and modify options, RSUs and other stock awards to employees who are not executive officers or directors, subject to specified thresholds, parameters and applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee held nine meetings (including by telephone conference) during fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Consultants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has the authority, in its sole discretion, to retain or obtain the advice of any independent legal, accounting or other advisors it deems necessary or appropriate to carry out its responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is empowered, without further action by the Board of Directors, to cause the Company to pay the compensation of these advisors as established by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee retained Pearl Meyer and Partners (PM), an independent compensation consultant, during fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PM reports directly to the Compensation Committee and assists the Compensation Committee in evaluating and designing our executive and director compensation program and policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal 2016, the Compensation Committee instructed PM to assist it in defining a peer group of companies, compare our executive and director compensation arrangements to those of the peer group, assist it in defining a comparator group of companies for the 2016 performance-based RSUs and provide market data and advice regarding executive and director compensation plan design.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PM conducted a detailed analysis of the competitiveness and appropriateness of the Companys total executive compensation opportunity in comparison to our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PM also conducted a risk assessment of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with its work for the Compensation Committee, PM is invited to attend many of the Compensation Committees meetings and, upon request of the Compensation Committee, attends executive sessions of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PM is retained only by the Compensation Committee and does not provide any other consulting services to Analog Devices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also solicits advice from time to time from our outside counsel, WilmerHale.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee assesses the independence of its advisors on an annual basis.

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee requested and received an
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: independence letter from each of PM and WilmerHale providing information to assist the Compensation Committee in selecting and receiving advice from such advisor after considering the independence factors that are identified in the NASDAQ rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determined that the engagement of these advisors did not raise any conflicts of interest for all work performed for the Compensation Committee during fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The activities of our Compensation Committee and the services PM performed for the Compensation Committee during fiscal 2016 are further described in INFORMATION ABOUT EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION  Compensation Discussion and Analysis below.

sentences.text: Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary responsibility of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee is to identify individuals qualified to become Board members consistent with criteria approved by the Board of Directors, recommend to the Board of Directors the persons to be nominated by the Board of Directors for election as directors at any meeting of shareholders, recommend to the Board of Directors the directors to be appointed to each committee of the Board of Directors, develop and recommend to the Board of Directors a set of corporate governance principles and oversee the evaluation of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee also leads the Board of Directors succession planning efforts with respect to senior executives and oversight of our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee is empowered, without further action by the Board of Directors, to cause the Company to pay the compensation of these advisors as established by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For information relating to nominations of directors by our shareholders, see  Director Candidates above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee held five meetings during fiscal 2016 (including by telephone conference).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors Role in Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our management team is responsible for day-to-day risk management activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors role in the Companys risk oversight process includes receiving regular reports from members of senior management on areas of material risk to the Company, including operational, financial, legal and regulatory, and strategic and reputational risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of management report to the Board of Directors (or the appropriate committee in the case of risks that are under the purview of a particular committee) regarding risk identification, risk management and risk mitigation strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, the Audit Committee discusses ADIs policies with respect to risk assessment and risk management as they apply to ADIs financial statement integrity and reporting and internal controls.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also receives regular reports from our Director of Internal Audit on internal audit matters and an annual report from our Chief Information Officer on information security, technology and data privacy and protection.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers whether ADIs executive compensation program and non-executive director compensation practices encourages excessive or inappropriate risk taking, and the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee leads the Board with respect to the adequacy of the Companys governance structure and process and of succession planning for the Companys Board of Directors, Chief Executive Officer and other executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Report of the Audit Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee of the Board of Directors assisted the Board of Directors oversight of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the integrity of our financial statements and the Companys systems of internal control over financial reporting and disclosure controls and procedures,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the qualifications and independence of our independent registered public accounting firm, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the performance of our internal audit function and independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also met privately with our independent registered public accounting firm and our Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: of Internal Audit to discuss our financial statements and disclosures, accounting policies and their application, internal controls over financial reporting, and other matters of importance to the Audit Committee, the independent registered public accounting firm and the internal auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management has the primary responsibility for the financial statements and the reporting process, including the system of internal controls over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fulfilling its oversight responsibilities, the Audit Committee reviewed and discussed with management the audited financial statements contained in our Annual Report on Form 10-K and the quarterly financial statements during fiscal 2016, including the specific disclosures in the section titled Managements Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These discussions also addressed the quality, not just the acceptability, of the accounting principles, the reasonableness of significant judgments, and the clarity of disclosures in the financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reported on these meetings to our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also selected and appointed our independent registered public accounting firm, reviewed the performance of the independent registered public accounting firm during the annual audit and on assignments unrelated to the audit, assessed the independence of the independent registered public accounting firm, and reviewed and approved the independent registered public accounting firms fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also has adopted policies and procedures for the pre-approval of audit and non-audit services for the purpose of maintaining the independence of our independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee operates under a written charter adopted by our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reviewed with our independent registered public accounting firm, who are responsible for expressing an opinion on the conformity of the audited financial statements with generally accepted accounting principles, their judgments as to the quality, not just the acceptability, of our accounting principles and such other matters as are required to be discussed with the Audit Committee under generally accepted auditing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit Committee has discussed with the independent registered public accounting firm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the matters to be discussed as required by Auditing Standard No. 16, Communications with Audit Committees, as adopted by the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the independent registered public accounting firms independence from Analog Devices and its management, including the matters in the written disclosures and the letter we received from the independent registered public accounting firm required by the PCAOB Ethics and Independence Rule 3526, Communication with Audit Committees Concerning Independence, regarding the independent registered public accounting firms communications with the Audit Committee on independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee considered the appropriateness of the provision of non-audit services by the independent registered public accounting firm relative to their independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on its review and discussions referred to above, the Audit Committee recommended to our Board of Directors (and the Board of Directors approved) that our audited financial statements be included in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended October 29, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also selected Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending October 28, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These are fees related to professional services rendered in connection with the audit of our consolidated financial statements, the audit of the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting, the reviews of our interim financial statements included in each of our Quarterly Reports on Form 10-Q, international statutory audits, reviews and comfort letter procedures related to our filings on Form S-3, assistance with registration statements and other periodic filings, and accounting consultations that relate to the audited financial statements and are necessary to comply with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit-Related Fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These are fees for assurance and related services and consisted primarily of audits of employee benefit plans, due diligence and consultations regarding proposed transactions, including, for fiscal 2016, due diligence services relating to the proposed acquisition of Linear Technology Corporation, and accounting matters not related to the annual audit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These are fees for professional services related to tax return preparation services for our expatriates, international tax returns, tax advice and planning, assistance with international tax audits and merger and acquisition tax advice and services, including services relating to the proposed acquisition of Linear Technology Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Included in this amount are fees of $508,000 in fiscal 2016, and $476,000 in fiscal 2015, for tax compliance services for our international affiliates and tax return preparation services for our expatriate employees on international assignments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ernst & Young LLP does not provide tax services to any person in a financial reporting oversight role at Analog Devices.

sentences.text: Audit Committees Pre-Approval Policy and Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee of our Board of Directors has adopted policies and procedures for the pre-approval of audit and non-audit services for the purpose of maintaining the independence of our independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We may not engage our independent registered public accounting firm to render any audit or non-audit service unless either the service is approved in advance by the Audit Committee or the engagement to render the service is entered into pursuant to the Audit Committees pre-approval policies and procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On an annual basis, the Audit Committee may pre-approve services that are expected to be provided to Analog Devices by the independent registered public accounting firm during the following 12 months.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the time the pre-approval is granted, the Audit Committee must (1) identify the particular pre-approved services in a sufficient level of detail so that management will not be called upon to make a judgment as to whether a proposed service fits within the pre-approved services and (2) establish a monetary limit with respect to each particular pre-approved service, which limit may not be exceeded without obtaining further pre-approval under the policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At regularly scheduled meetings of the Audit Committee, management or the independent registered public accounting firm must report to the Audit Committee regarding each service actually provided to Analog Devices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the cost of any service exceeds the pre-approved monetary limit, that service must be approved (1) by the entire Audit Committee if the cost of the service exceeds $100,000 or (2) by the Chairman of the Audit Committee if the cost of the service is less than $100,000 but greater than $10,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the cost of any service exceeds the pre-approved monetary limit, individual items with a cost of less than $10,000 each do not require further pre-approval, provided that the total cost of all individual items does not exceed $40,000 and an update of all items in this category is provided to the Audit Committee at each quarterly scheduled meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if the cost of all the individual items will exceed $40,000, the Chairman of the Audit Committee must receive a summary of those items with a request for approval of any amounts to be incurred in excess of $40,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has delegated authority to the Chairman of the Audit Committee to pre-approve any audit or non-audit services to be provided to Analog Devices by the independent registered public accounting firm for which the cost is less than $100,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal years 2016 and 2015, all services provided to Analog Devices by Ernst & Young LLP were pre-approved in accordance with the pre-approval policies and procedures described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines for Non-Employee Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our stock ownership guidelines, the target share ownership level for non-employee directors is at least four times the directors annual cash retainer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors have four years to achieve their targeted level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares subject to unexercised options, whether or not vested, and any shares that have been pledged as collateral for a loan will not be counted for purposes of satisfying these guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unvested RSUs are counted for purposes of satisfying the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our non-employee directors were in compliance with our stock ownership guidelines as of the end of fiscal 2016.

sentences.text: Equity Award Policy for Non-Employee Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal 2016, our equity award grant policy for non-employee directors provided for the following
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each newly elected non-employee director elected other than at an annual meeting of shareholders is automatically granted under the 2006 Stock Incentive Plan:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) a non-qualified stock option to purchase a number of shares of our common stock approved by the Board of Directors at an exercise price equal to the closing price of our common stock on the grant date; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) an RSU award for a number of shares of our common stock approved by the Board of Directors, each on the 15th day of the month following the month of the date of initial election as a director, or if NASDAQ is closed on that day, the next succeeding business day that NASDAQ is open.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On an annual basis, each non-employee director elected or re-elected at an annual meeting of shareholders is automatically granted under the 2006 Stock Incentive Plan:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) a non-qualified stock option to purchase a number of shares of our common stock approved by the Board of Directors at an exercise price equal to the closing price of our common stock on the grant date; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) a RSU award for a number of shares of our common stock approved by the Board of Directors, each on the date of our annual meeting of shareholders, or if NASDAQ is closed on that day, the next succeeding business day that NASDAQ is open.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, stock options and RSUs granted to our non-employee directors under the 2006 Stock Incentive Plan vest on the earlier of the date of the Annual Meeting and the first anniversary of the date of grant, subject to acceleration as described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These awards vest in full upon the occurrence of a Change in Control Event (as defined in the 2006 Stock Incentive Plan) or the directors death.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the director ceases to serve as a director by reason of his or her disability, as determined by the Board of Directors, each outstanding and unvested option and RSU will vest in full at the time he or she ceases to be a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, upon the occurrence of a Change in Control Event or in the event of the directors death, disability or retirement after age 60, each vested option will continue to be exercisable for the balance of its term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Commencing with the fiscal 2017 annual grants, our newly-elected and re- elected directors will receive 100% of the value of their annual equity award in the form of RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes this change better aligns with market practice among our peers.

sentences.text: The vesting provisions of the equity awards remained unchanged.

(Lyric) for $14 million in the aggregate at closing, with additional contingent earn out payments based on the achievement of certain product-based milestones of up to $15 million and royalty payments of up to $25 million based on product sales following the closing.

sentences.text: In addition, Stata Venture Partners II, LLC, a venture capital fund, held a significant equity position in Lyric.

sentences.text: Mr. Stata serves as a general partner of Stata Venture Holdings II, LLC, which is a general partner of Stata Venture Partners II, LLC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the satisfaction of conditions set forth in the partnership agreement for Stata Venture Partners II, LLC.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No consideration was paid to Stata Venture Partners II, LLC in fiscal 2016.

sentences.text: The acquisition, and Mr. Statas interests therein, were reviewed and approved by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee in accordance with our policies and procedures for related person transactions described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policies and Procedures for Related Person Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has adopted written policies and procedures for the review of any transaction, arrangement or relationship in which Analog Devices is a participant, the amount involved exceeds $120,000, and one of our executive officers, directors, director nominees or 5% shareholders (or their immediate family members, each of whom we refer to as a related person has a direct or indirect material interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a related person proposes to enter into such a transaction, arrangement or relationship, which we refer to as a related person transaction, the related person must report the proposed related person transaction to our General Counsel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy calls for the proposed related person transaction to be reviewed and, if deemed appropriate, approved by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whenever practicable, the reporting, review and approval will occur prior to entry into the transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If advance review and approval is not practicable, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee will review, and, in its discretion, may ratify the related person transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy also permits the Chairman of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee to review and, if deemed appropriate, approve proposed related person transactions that arise between committee meetings, subject to ratification by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee at its next meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any related person transactions that are ongoing in nature will be reviewed annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A related person transaction reviewed under the policy will be considered approved or ratified if it is authorized by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee after full disclosure of the related persons interest in the transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As appropriate for the circumstances, the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee will review and consider:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the related persons interest in the related person transaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the approximate dollar value of the amount involved in the related person transaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the approximate dollar value of the amount of the related persons interest in the transaction without regard to the amount of any profit or loss;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: whether the transaction was undertaken in the ordinary course of our business;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: whether the terms of the transaction are no less favorable to us than the terms that could have been reached with an unrelated third party;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the purpose of, and the potential benefits to us of, the transaction; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any other information regarding the related person transaction or the related person in the context of the proposed transaction that would be material to investors in light of the circumstances of the particular transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee may approve or ratify the transaction only if the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee determines that, under all of the circumstances, the transaction is in Analog Devices best interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee may impose any conditions on the related person transaction that it deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the transactions that are excluded by the instructions to the SECs related person transaction disclosure rule, the Board of Directors has determined that the following transactions do not create a material direct or indirect interest on behalf of related persons and, therefore, are not related person transactions for purposes of this policy:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: interests arising solely from the related persons position as an executive officer of another entity (whether or not the person is also a director of that entity), that is a participant in a transaction, where
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the related person and all other related persons own in the aggregate less than a 10% equity interest in the entity,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the related person and his or her immediate family members are not involved in the negotiation of the terms of the transaction and do not receive any special benefits as a result of the transaction, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) the amount involved in the transaction equals less than the greater of $200,000 or 5% of the annual gross revenues of the company receiving payment under the transaction; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the transactions that are specifically contemplated by provisions of Analog Devices charter or bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy provides that the transactions involving compensation of executive officers shall be reviewed and approved by the Compensation Committee in the manner specified in its charter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 2  ADVISORY VOTE ON THE COMPENSATION OF OUR NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are requesting shareholder approval of the compensation of the executive officers named in our Summary Compensation Table below, who we refer to as our named executive officers or NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proposal, which is commonly referred to as say-on-pay, is required by the Dodd-Frank Act, which added Section 14A to the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are required to provide our shareholders with the opportunity to vote to approve, on an advisory (non-binding) basis, the compensation of our NEOs as disclosed in this proxy statement in accordance with the SECs rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors is asking shareholders to approve the following non-binding advisory resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the compensation paid to the Companys NEOs, as disclosed pursuant to Item 402 of Regulation S-K, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, compensation tables and accompanying narrative disclosures in this proxy statement, is hereby approved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required by the Dodd-Frank Act, this is an advisory vote, which means that this proposal is not binding on us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee, however, values the opinions expressed by our shareholders and will carefully consider the outcome of the vote when making future compensation decisions for our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote for, against or abstain from voting on this matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 annual meeting of shareholders, our compensation program for our NEOs received the support of 98.4% of the total votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in detail in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section of this proxy statement, ADIs executive compensation program is significantly performance-based and designed to attract, retain and motivate strong executives to lead our complex, global organization and to align their interests with those of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We seek to provide total compensation to our executives that is competitive with our peers, and we believe that our executive compensation program is designed to encourage the most talented individuals to grow their careers at ADI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ADI has a longstanding philosophy and practice of paying executives for performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to align our pay practices with shareholder interests, we tie a significant percentage of each executives compensation to the Companys performance, in the form of variable cash incentive bonus payments and equity awards that rise in value only if our stock price increases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal 2016, a year in which ADI executed well and continued to deliver strong profits, aggregate payments under our cash incentive bonus plan were made at 85% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This was a result of exceeding our profitability target, but not achieving our year-over-year revenue growth target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our executive compensation program is working as intended and appropriately aligns executive pay with Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR approval of the compensation of our named executive officers as disclosed in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 3  FREQUENCY OF FUTURE ADVISORY VOTES ON THE COMPENSATION OF OUR NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are required to submit a non-binding, advisory resolution to shareholders at least once every six years to determine whether future advisory votes on the compensation paid of our NEOs should be held every year, every two years or every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2011 annual meeting of shareholders, our shareholders approved an advisory resolution to approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of our NEOs once every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the results of that vote, our Board of Directors determined to implement an advisory vote on the compensation of our NEOs every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are once again asking shareholders to advise us as to how frequently they wish to cast an advisory vote on the compensation of our NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors believes that an annual advisory vote on the compensation of our NEOs will facilitate more direct shareholder input about executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An annual advisory vote is consistent with the policy of reviewing our executive compensation program annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In arriving at our recommendation on the frequency vote, we reviewed the results of our previous shareholder voting in 2011, when an annual vote was approved by a majority of the shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required by the Dodd-Frank Act, this is an advisory vote, which means that this proposal is not binding on us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regardless, our Board of Directors values the opinions expressed by shareholders and expects to implement the frequency which receives the greatest level of support from our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are not voting to approve or disapprove our recommendation of each year, but rather to make your own choice among a vote once every year, every two years or every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may also abstain from voting on this item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recommend that you vote in favor of future advisory votes on the compensation of our named executive officers to be held EVERY YEAR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: INFORMATION ABOUT EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion and Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We intend to provide compensation for our executives that is competitive with our peers, with an opportunity for increased compensation if the Companys performance warrants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The elements of our executives total compensation are base salary, variable cash incentive awards, long-term equity compensation awards, and retirement and other employee benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have designed our compensation program to make a substantial percentage of our executive pay variable, subject to increase when corporate targets are overachieved and reduction when corporate targets are not reached.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Processes and Philosophy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Executive Compensation Program is designed to attract and retain top executive talent and align the interests of our executives and our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We accomplish this through the following steps:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. First, we ensure our executive compensation is competitive and attracts and retains top executive talent by understanding how the total target compensation (consisting of salary, bonus and equity awards) of our named executive officers, or NEOs, compares to the median total target compensation of those in similar positions within our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. We then consider a variety of factors, including the scope of the role and the performance and experience of the individual when deciding how each NEOs total target compensation compares to the median total target compensation of those in similar positions within our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. We structure our compensation package to align executives interests with those of our shareholders by tying a significant portion of their total compensation directly to ADIs short- and long-term performance, measured by operating profit before taxes as a percentage of revenue, or OPBT margin and year-over-year revenue growth, which both drive shareholder value, stock price appreciation and relative total shareholder return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Chief Executive Officers compensation is described in more detail below under  Chief Executive Officer Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our other NEOs compensation is described in more detail below under  Compensation for Other Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Business Results
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our fiscal year ended October 29, 2016, or fiscal 2016, was a year of strong execution for Analog Devices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our business model generated gross margins of 65.1%, operating margins of 30.0%, operating cash flow of approximately $1.3 billion, or 37.4% of revenue and free cash flow of approximately $1.2 billion, or 33.7% of revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also returned approximately $883 million to shareholders in the form of dividends and share repurchases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to strong business results, in fiscal 2016, we announced the proposed acquisition of Linear Technology Corporation, which once complete, will create a high-performance analog leader, with the combined company having a top two market share position across all the key building blocks of the analog market, namely: data converters, power management, amplifiers, interface, and high-performance RF and microwave.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the most comparable GAAP financial measure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Data based on Gartner reports and Company estimates based on Fiscal 2015 data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RF/Microwave is based on Company estimates and excludes consumer and cellular infrastructure power amplifiers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Say on Pay Feedback from Shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year we submit our executive compensation program to an advisory vote of our shareholders as required by Section 14A of the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, our executive compensation program received the support of 98.4% of the total votes cast at our 2016 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We pay careful attention to any feedback we receive from our shareholders about our executive compensation program including the say on pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the course of the year, we held in-person and telephonic meetings with a number of shareholders to discuss a variety of matters, including our executive compensation program and how they evaluate it.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee carefully considers this feedback when making decisions regarding executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A significant portion of the total targeted compensation of our NEOs is directly linked to Company performance in the form of cash incentive bonus payments and equity awards (88% for the Chief Executive Officer and 82% on average for the other NEOs).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this provides our executives an opportunity to earn above peer average compensation if ADI delivers strong results, and conversely, if the Company delivers weaker results, our executives would earn less compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variable Cash Incentive Bonus Payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We link a significant portion of our executives cash compensation to ADIs performance, measured by our OPBT margin and year-over-year revenue growth on a quarterly basis, through our performance incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All employees participate in our performance incentive plan, which provides us with a variable compensation structure, allowing us to reduce our compensation costs in challenging times and to reward performance when business conditions and results warrant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance metrics for our cash incentive plan are identical for employees and executives alike, which we believe drives consistent business goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, the Compensation Committee set target percentages of 150% of base salary for our Chief Executive Officer and between 80%-100% of base salary for our remaining NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee selected these target bonus percentages to ensure that a substantial portion of each executives cash compensation is directly linked to our business performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our performance incentive plan takes into consideration our actual business results, compared to the strategic performance targets we set for our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In setting our targets, we use an assessment of our business results relative to our peers to ensure that our performance targets are appropriately calibrated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committees independent consultant, Pearl Meyer and Partners (PM), conducted an analysis that compared our performance against the three-year average performance of our peers, including OPBT margin and year-over-year revenue growth, to help us determine the appropriate targets for each quarter of fiscal 2016, which were unchanged from fiscal 2015 targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The three-year average OPBT margin for our peer group was 21%, compared to our target of 30% for each quarter of fiscal 2016, and our 30% target also exceeded the peer group median for each of the past three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The three-year average revenue growth for our peer group was 6%, compared to our target of 8% for each quarter of fiscal 2016, and our 8% target exceeds the peer group median for two of the past three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also link pay and performance by providing a significant amount of our executives compensation in the form of equity awards, the value of which is directly tied to our stock price performance over the long term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal 2016, approximately 65% of the average total targeted compensation of our NEOs was in the form of equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal 2016, the form and mix of equity awards delivered as part of our annual equity award program for our executive officers was as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-Based RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approximately 33% of the value was delivered in the form of performance-based RSUs, under which the number of shares of ADI common stock received following vesting will be based on ADIs total shareholder return, or TSR, performance (defined as share price appreciation plus cumulative cash dividend payments) measured against the median TSR of a defined comparator group of companies over a three-
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance-based RSUs were added to the equity award compensation element for executives in 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These performance-based RSUs for our executives ensure a direct link between the value of our long-term incentives and the value that is created for our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time-Based RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approximately 33% of the value was delivered in the form of time-based RSUs, which increase or decrease in value depending on our share performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approximately 33% of the value of our executives equity was delivered in the form of stock options that provide a direct link between these awards and the appreciation of the stock owned by our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total Shareholder Return
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We calculate and evaluate our TSR performance annually in March in connection with the vesting of our performance-based RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fiscal 2014 was the first year that we included performance-based RSUs as part of our executives annual equity award compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the performance period for the 2014 performance-based RSUs will not end until March 12, 2017, in fiscal 2016 we measured TSR as of the second anniversary of the grant of those awards, or March 12, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On a one-, two- and three-year cumulative basis, our TSR performance was -13.58%, 7.38% and 27.6%, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On the same basis, the median TSR performance of the 2014 performance-based RSU award comparator group was -0.2%, 5.32% and 32.7%, respectively, which ranked our TSR performance at the 13th percentile, 50th percentile and 38th percentile of comparator group performance, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For illustrative purposes, if the 2014 performance-based RSUs had a two-year performance period (rather than a three-year performance period) and vested on March 12, 2016, they would have paid out at 104% of target under the terms of our performance-based RSU award agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information about our performance-based RSUs, see  Components of Executive Compensation  Equity Compensation below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of calculating TSR performance, we use the TSR calculation set forth in our performance-based RSU award agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The periods used to calculate share price appreciation and dividends paid are held constant and the beginning stock price used is the average of the closing prices of the applicable stock for the 90 calendar days starting and including the first day of the measured period and the ending stock price used is the average of the closing price of the applicable stock for the 90 calendar days up to and including the last day of the measured period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Companies in the 2014 performance-based RSU award comparator group that are not publicly traded as of the date of the TSR calculation are not included in the calculation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay and Governance Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our pay and governance practices are designed to align our executives interests with our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We prohibit hedging transactions and short sales involving ADI securities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We prohibit holding ADI securities in margin account
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We prohibit pledging ADI securities as collateral for a loan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benchmarking
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making its compensation determinations, the Compensation Committee annually reviews the total compensation that each of our executives is eligible to receive against the compensation levels of comparable positions of a peer group of companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has sought to select peer companies that are publicly traded, headquartered in the United States, compete with us for talent, and are similar to ADI in their product and services offerings, business model, revenue size and market capitalization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The composition of the peer group is reviewed annually by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In June 2015, the Compensation Committee conducted its annual peer group review for our fiscal 2016 executive compensation determinations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The median annual revenue of our peer group at that time was $2.9 billion, compared to our trailing four quarters revenue of $3.1 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The median market capitalization of our peer group at that time was $11.8 billion, compared to our market capitalization of $19.7 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, with input from PM, felt that it was appropriate to maintain the peer group used by the Compensation Committee to evaluate executive compensation in fiscal 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some companies in our peer group (such as Texas Instruments) fall outside of our selection range.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We include them in the peer group, however, because they have similar product and services offerings as ADI, they are direct competitors of ADI, we compete with them for talent, and/or they include ADI in their own peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because executive compensation comparisons are done using percentiles, rather than averages, we do not believe the data becomes skewed if a company falls outside our selection range.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The peer group used by the Compensation Committee in fiscal 2016 to evaluate executive compensation consisted of the following companies:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Freescale Semiconductor, Inc.

sentences.text: Skyworks Solutions Inc.

sentences.text: Linear Technology Corp.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Texas Instruments Inc.

sentences.text: For officers in positions for which the fiscal 2016 peer group companies do not publicly disclose compensation data, the Compensation Committee reviewed data collected from Radfords Global Technology Survey.

sentences.text: This survey depicts executive compensation levels across a wide spectrum of technology sector companies comparable in revenue size.
