sentences.text: Developments After the 2016 Fiscal Year
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In September 2016, the Compensation Committee engaged PM to conduct a review of the composition of the Companys peer group for fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to the pending acquisition of Linear Technology Corporation, which will substantially increase the Companys size and complexity, the Compensation Committee instructed PM to perform its analysis and present its recommendation on both a pre-acquisition and post-acquisition basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of rapid consolidation in the semiconductor industry over the last several years, in addition to companies that meet the criteria outlined above for our fiscal 2016 peer group, the pre-acquisition and post-acquisition peer groups for fiscal 2017 include additional semiconductor companies outside of our historic peer group, as well as companies outside of the semiconductor industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These additional companies are similar in size and have similar gross margins and research and development spend as the Company, including peers of peers and peers of other companies in our sector.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In September 2016, the Compensation Committee approved the pre-acquisition peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also conceptually approved the post-acquisition peer group, and plans to approve the post-acquisition peer group following the close of the pending acquisition of Linear.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Depending on the timing of the proposed acquisition of Linear, data collected from either the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: pre-acquisition or post-acquisition peer group, as appropriate, will be used when reviewing market data in support of the compensation decisions for the Companys executive officers in fiscal 2017, including base salary, cash incentive bonus awards targets and long-term equity compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Components of Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual compensation for our executive officers consists of the following principal elements:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Element    Objective    Fixed/Variable   Base Salary    Attract and retain talent and provide stable source of income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fixed Cash Incentive Bonus Award    Link pay and annual Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Align executive compensation with the financial performance of the Company and our achievement of OPBT margin and year-over-year revenue growth, which are measured quarterly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variable Long-Term Equity Compensation    Link pay and long-term Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reward stock price appreciation, promote long-term retention and permit executives to accumulate equity ownership in the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variable Retirement and Other Employee Benefits    Retain talent by providing financial protection and security.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fixed
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use the median base salary for similar positions within our peer group as an important factor in setting a base salary that can attract and retain talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When setting the base salary for each individual NEO, the Compensation Committee also considers other factors, including the scope of the role and the performance and experience of the individual.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fiscal 2016 Executive Performance Incentive Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In September 2015, the Compensation Committee approved the terms of our fiscal 2016 Executive Performance Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The plan is designed to be variable, depending on ADIs operating results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive and employee bonuses are calculated using the same plan targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All executive officers, including our NEOs, participated in our executive performance incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We calculated and paid bonuses under the fiscal 2016 plan as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary    X    Individual Target Bonus Percentage    X    Bonus Payout Factor    =    Bonus Payou
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual Target Bonus Percentage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, the Compensation Committee set target percentages of 150% of base salary for our Chief Executive Officer and between 80%-100% of base salary for our remaining
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee selected these target bonus percentages to ensure that a substantial portion of each executives cash compensation is linked directly to our business performance, and to ensure that total compensation is competitive with companies in our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Chief Executive Officers target was set at 150% in order to tie the majority of his cash compensation directly to Company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The bonus target for our remaining NEOs provides those executives with a performance-based opportunity to earn total target compensation benchmarked against the median total target compensation of those in similar positions within our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bonus Payout Factor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, we based the Bonus Payout Factor for the applicable quarterly bonus period on our OPBT margin and year-over-year revenue growth compared to the same quarter in the prior year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The OPBT margin and year-over-year revenue growth targets for each quarter of fiscal 2016 were 30% and 8%, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These targets were equally applicable to our executives and our non-executive employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The profitability target reflects the improvements we have made to our business performance in recent years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The growth target was chosen following review of the historical growth rates of our business and those of our peers in recent years, as well as our strategic performance targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While our executive performance incentive plan contains quarterly performance targets, the Compensation Committee designed this plan to drive long-term performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The targets are directly linked to our long-term corporate strategy of improving OPBT margin and increasing revenue growth, which drives shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this combination ensures that we encourage a long- term focus on our business objectives, while measuring and rewarding progress against those objectives on a quarterly basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may adjust the OPBT margin and year-over-year revenue growth metrics in its sole discretion to exclude special items such as (but not limited to) restructuring-related expense, acquisition-related expense, gain or loss on disposition of businesses, non-recurring royalty payments, and other similar non-cash or non-recurring items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may, in its discretion, exclude these items in order to prevent payments under the plan from being adversely or advantageously affected by special items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of determining the bonus payout factor for each quarter of fiscal 2016, OPBT margin was adjusted to exclude acquisition-related expenses, acquisition-related transaction costs and restructuring-related expenses, consistent with the non-GAAP operating margin reported in our fiscal 2016 quarterly earnings releases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews and approves our performance targets at the beginning of each fiscal year, and historically these targets have not been re-set during the year, regardless of Company performance or economic conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that this approach fosters accountability for our business results and is in keeping with our core belief that variable compensation expense, which increases when our performance is good and contracts when it is poor, gives us maximum flexibility to operate our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the OPBT margin and year-over-year revenue growth targets are set annually, we measure performance against those targets on a quarterly basis, applying the corresponding Bonus Payout Factor to base salary for that quarter, and pay the bonus amounts on a semi-annual basis following the end of the second and fourth quarters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, we maintained challenging OPBT margin and year-over-year revenue growth targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We selected the OPBT margin and year-over-year revenue growth targets in part based on the historical averages of those metrics for our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The three-year average OPBT margin for our peer group was 21%, compared to our target of 30% for each quarter of fiscal 2016, and our 30% target also exceeds the peer group median for each of the past three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The three-year average year-over-year revenue growth for our peer group was 6%, compared to our target of 8% for each quarter of fiscal 2016, and our 8% target exceeded the peer group median for two of the past three fiscal years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given historical profit margins in the industry, we do not pay any bonus if profit margins fall to 20% or below, regardless of what revenue level we achieve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, if revenue does not grow, we do not pay on that portion of the bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We capped the Bonus Payout Factor at 300% of target, and a 300% bonus payout would require us to achieve OPBT margins at or above 40% and year-over-year revenue growth levels at or above 28%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, the calculated OPBT Margin, Year-Over-Year Revenue Growth and Bonus Payout Factor for each quarter were as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OPBT Margin (50% weight)   Revenue Growth (50% weight)   Quarterly Bonus Payout Factor (average)   OPBT Margin (by quarter)   Bonus Payout Factor (by quarter)   YOY Revenue Growth (by quarter)   Bonus Payout Factor (by quarter)   Q1   27.8%   0.78   (0.3)%   0.00   0.39 Q2   30.8%   1.16   (5.1)%   0.00   0.58 Q3   34.1%   1.82   0.7%   0.09   0.96 Q4   38.1%   2.62   2.5%   0.31   1.47
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal 2016, a year in which we had solid execution with strong profitability, but did not achieve our year-over-year revenue growth targets each quarter, aggregate payments under our executive performance incentive plan were made at 85% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Funding of Executive Performance Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, the Compensation Committee intends to structure and administer executive compensation plans and arrangements so that they will not be subject to the deduction limit under Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Compensation Committee may from time to time approve payments that cannot be deducted in order to maintain flexibility in structuring appropriate compensation programs in the interest of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Executive Section 162(m) Plan, or the 162(m) plan, is a separate plan approved by shareholders that allows for the annual bonus compensation paid to certain of our executive officers under our executive performance incentive plan to become eligible for deduction when it may not otherwise be deductible as a result of Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal 2016, Messrs. Roche and Hess were designated to participate under the 162(m) plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the 162(m) plan, at the beginning of each fiscal year, the Compensation Committee allocates to each designated participant a portion of the annual incentive pool which is funded with 2% of the Companys profits as described in the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the 162(m) plan, the Compensation Committee may use its discretion to decrease, but not increase, the amounts that may be paid to the participants out of their allocation of the funded incentive pool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has exercised this discretion by applying the performance goals of our executive performance incentive plan to the participants allocation of the funded incentive pool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, the 162(m) plan funded the incentive pool with an aggregate of $20.4 million, of which an aggregate of $1.5 million was distributed to the NEO participants based on achievement of the performance goals under our executive performance incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our equity compensation program is a broad-based, long-term employee rewards program that is intended to attract, retain and motivate our employees, officers and directors and to align their interests with those of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our equity program is critical to our efforts to hire and retain the best talent in the extremely competitive analog semiconductor industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use stock options as a way to reward long-term value creation and time-based RSUs as a retention tool and to enable our executives to accumulate stock ownership in the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In a volatile stock market, RSUs continue to provide value when stock options may not, which the Compensation Committee believes will be useful in retaining talented executives and employees in uncertain economic times.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal 2016, the Compensation Committee also included variable performance-based RSUs as part of the long-term equity compensation granted to executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of shares of ADI common stock received by an executive officer following vesting of the performance-based RSUs will range from 0% to a maximum of 200% of the target amount based on ADIs TSR performance measured against the median TSR of an established comparator group over a three-year period, capped at a maximum of 100% of the initial number of performance-based RSUs granted if the Companys TSR is negative.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance parameters established by the Compensation Committee are equal to 100% plus or minus two times the difference between the Companys TSR and the comparator group median TSR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attainment among performance parameters is subject to interpolation on a linear basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The examples below illustrate how different scenarios would result in payouts
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ranging from 0% to a maximum of 200% of the target amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fourth example shows the payout calculation if the performance- based RSUs granted on March 12, 2014 had a two-year performance period (rather than a three-year performance period) and vested on March 12, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Scenario  Companys TSR    Comparator Group Median TSR     Difference Between Companys TSR and Comparator Group Median TSR     Difference Between Companys TSR and Comparator Group Median TSR x 2     Percentage Payout     Number of Shares Attained (assumes initial grant of 100 Performance-Based RSUs)   1    150%      200%      (50)%      (100)%      0%      0   2    (30)%      (10)%      (20)%      (40)%      60%      60   3    (10)%      (70)%      60%      120%      100%      100   4    7%      5%      2%      4%      104%      104   5    100%      80%      20%      40%      140%      140   6    70%      10%      60%      120%      200%      200
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our equity compensation program includes these performance-based RSUs for our executives to ensure that a direct link exists between the value of our long-term incentives and the value that is created for our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The comparator group designated for the performance-based RSUs granted in fiscal 2016 consisted of the companies represented in the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index (SOX Index) as of the grant date that are included in the SOX Index for the entire performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee chose this comparator group because it consists of publicly traded companies that compete in the semiconductor industry, are representative of likely alternative investment opportunities for our investors, compete with us for talent, and are similar to ADI in their product and services offerings and business model.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our Compensation Committees desire to tie pay to performance, the value of each of these awards is directly linked to the long-term performance of our stock price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of our annual equity awards to our executives is generally comprised of approximately 33% of stock options that vest over five years, approximately 33% of time-based RSUs that vest in full on the third anniversary of the grant date and approximately 33% of performance-based RSUs, which have a three-year performance period and vest in one installment 14 days after the third anniversary of the grant date subject to the achievement of applicable performance metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the value of the awards is based on our stock price, stock options, time-based RSUs and performance-based RSUs encourage recipients to focus on achievement of longer-term goals, such as strategic opportunities, technological innovation and shareholder return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We set a goal each year to keep the shareholder dilution related to our equity compensation program to a certain percentage, calculated as the total number of shares of common stock underlying new equity grants made during the year, divided by the total number of outstanding shares of our common stock at the beginning of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our gross and net dilution rate have been consistently lower than that of our peers over the past several years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, our gross dilution percentage was 0.9%, compared to an average of 1.4% for our peer group, and our net dilution percentage was 0.7%, compared to an average of 0.8% for our peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the last five years, our gross dilution percentage was 1.1% on average, compared to 1.80% on average for our peer group, and our net dilution percentage was 0.8% on average, compared to 1.1% on average for our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the fiscal year ended October 28, 2017, we set the maximum aggregate number of shares of common stock with respect to which awards may be granted under our 2006 Stock Incentive Plan for fiscal 2017 at 6 million shares, which equals approximately 2% of our outstanding common stock at the end of fiscal 2016 and remains unchanged from fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our guidelines, the target stock ownership levels are two times annual base salary for the Chief Executive Officer and one times annual base salary for other executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chief Executive Officer has
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: four years from the date of his appointment as CEO to achieve his targeted level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers other than the CEO have five years from the date he or she becomes an executive officer to achieve their targeted level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares subject to unexercised options, whether or not vested, will not be counted for purposes of satisfying these guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RSUs (whether or not vested) are counted for purposes of satisfying the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our executive officers were in compliance with our stock ownership guidelines as of the end of fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement and Other Employee Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain broad-based benefits for all employees, including health and dental insurance, life and disability insurance and retirement plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives are eligible to participate in all of our employee benefit plans on the same basis as our other employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The retirement and other employee benefit component of our executive compensation program is designed to attract excellent candidates by providing financial protection and security, and reward our executives for the total commitment we expect from them in service to ADI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain a Deferred Compensation Plan, or DCP, under which our executive officers and directors, along with a group of highly compensated management and engineering employees, are eligible to defer receipt of some or all of their cash compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This plan offers many of the same investment options as our 401(k) plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our DCP, we provide all participants (other than non-employee directors) with Company contributions equal to 8% of eligible deferred contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the United States, we contribute to our 401(k) plan on behalf all participants, including our NEOs, amounts equal to 5% of the employees eligible compensation, plus matching contributions up to an additional 3%, subject to Internal Revenue Service, or IRS, limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For those employees who also participate in the DCP described above, any compensation that is deferred under that plan is not considered eligible compensation for purposes of our Company contributions under the 401(k) plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also provide employees who are eligible to participate in the 401(k) plan but whose compensation is greater than the amount that may be taken into account in any plan year as a result of IRS limits ($265,000 for fiscal 2016), with a taxable payment equal to 8% of the employees 401(k)-eligible compensation in excess of the IRS limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Ireland, we contribute to our Irish Defined Contribution Plan on behalf of all participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants who had their benefits converted from the Analog Devices International Retirement and Death Benefit Plan to our Irish Defined Contribution Plan, including Peter Real, our Senior Vice President and Chief Technology Officer, and continue to participate in the Irish Defined Contribution Plan, contribute 5% of their pensionable salary to the Irish Defined Contribution Plan and the Company, in turn, contributes 15% of the participants pensionable salary, subject to limits established by the Irish tax authorities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants who were hired by our Irish subsidiaries after January 1, 2013, including Richard A. Meaney, a former Senior Vice President, are eligible to receive amounts equal to 5% of the employees eligible compensation, plus matching contributions up to an additional 3% of the employees eligible compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the plan rules, in fiscal 2016, Messrs. Real and Meaney opted out of the Irish Defined Contribution Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After opting out, they received a taxable payment equal to 13.5% and 4.5%, respectively, of their eligible compensation in lieu of our contributions into the Irish Defined Contribution Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limited Perquisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not award extensive perquisites to our executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The only perquisites provided to our executives in fiscal 2016 were an automobile and certain commuting expenses for each of Messrs. Real and Meaney.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal 2014 and 2015, we also reimbursed Mr. Meaney for his expenses in connection with his relocation to the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These items are detailed in the Summary Compensation Table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also maintain an expatriate program that provides certain benefits to our employees who accept expatriate assignments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers are entitled to the same benefits under the Companys expatriate program as other Company employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Companys expatriate program, such benefits include providing gross-ups on taxable foreign assignment assistance and making tax equalization payments on behalf of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (or to) expatriate employees who, as a result of their expatriate assignment, incur tax liabilities in excess of what they would have incurred had they not accepted the expatriate assignment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We did not provide tax equalization payments to any of our NEOs in fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Recovery
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Sarbanes-Oxley Act, in the event of misconduct that results in a financial restatement that would have reduced a previously paid incentive amount, we can recoup those improper payments from our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will implement a broader clawback policy that is compliant with the regulations mandated under the Dodd-Frank Act when the regulations are adopted by the SEC and corresponding listing standards become effective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chief Executive Officer Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Roche has served as our Chief Executive Officer since May 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining Mr. Roches compensation as Chief Executive Officer for fiscal 2016, the Compensation Committee considered all elements of Mr. Roches compensation and compared his total target compensation to the median of Chief Executive Officer compensation within our peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The design of Mr. Roches fiscal 2016 compensation provides incentives that linked realized compensation with Company performance and is comprised of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual base salary of $848,000, an increase of 6% compared to Mr. Roches fiscal 2015 annual base salary of $800,000;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual target bonus of 150% of base salary, calculated in accordance with the terms of the Companys executive performance incentive plan, which remain unchanged from fiscal 2015; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A performance-based RSU grant with a Black-Scholes value of $1,933,367 (32,796 shares), a time-based RSU grant with a Black-Scholes value of $1,639,144 (32,796 shares), and an option grant with a Black-Scholes value of $1,633,514 (127,305 shares).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of shares, if any, earned under the performance-based RSU grant will vest three years and fourteen days after its grant date, subject to the level of attainment of the performance parameters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Roches time-based RSU grant will vest in full on the third anniversary of its grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Roches option grant will vest 20% per year on each of the first five anniversaries of the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These vesting terms are identical to those generally contained in our employee equity grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance, Retention and Change in Control Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have entered into change in control retention agreements with each of our executive officers (other than Mr. Hess) and other key employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among other things, these retention agreements provide for severance benefits if the employees service with us is terminated within 24 months after a change in control (as defined in each agreement) that was approved by our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with our acquisition of Hittite, we also entered into an employment agreement with Mr. Hess, which provides for severance benefits if Mr. Hess service with us is terminated within 24 months after a change in control (as defined in the agreement).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See  Change in Control Benefits below for additional information about these agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We designed the change in control retention agreements and Mr. Hess employment agreement to help ensure that our executive team is able to evaluate objectively whether a potential change in control transaction is in the best interests of ADI and our shareholders, without having to be concerned about their future employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that retaining the services of our key executives during a change in control scenario is critical.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These agreements help ensure the continued services of our executive officers throughout the change in control transaction by giving them incentives to remain with us rather than seeking alternative employment or being recruited to a competitor during a highly uncertain time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviewed prevalent market practices in determining the severance amounts and the events that trigger payments under the agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee determined that the amounts and triggering events were appropriate and designed to encourage decision-making that is in the best interests of ADI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee has adopted specific policies regarding the grant dates of stock options, RSUs and other stock- based awards for our executive officers and employees.

sentences.text: In each case, the exercise price of stock options equals the closing price of our common stock on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New Hire Grants: The grant date of all awards to newly hired executive officers and employees is the 15  day of the month after the date on which the individual commences employment with us (or the next succeeding business day that NASDAQ is open).

sentences.text: Tax and Accounting Considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code, generally disallows a tax deduction to public companies for certain compensation in excess of $1 million paid to a companys chief executive officer and the three other executive officers (excluding the chief financial officer) whose compensation is required to be disclosed to our shareholders under the Exchange Act by reason of being among our other three most highly compensated officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain compensation, including qualified performance-based compensation, will not be subject to the deduction limit if certain requirements are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal 2013, the shareholders approved our 162(m) plan which is intended to allow the annual bonuses that we pay to our executives to be exempt from Section 162(m) as qualified performance-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, however, reviews the potential effect of Section 162(m) periodically, and the Compensation Committee reserves the right to use its judgment to authorize compensation payments that may be subject to the Section 162(m) deduction limit when the Compensation Committee believes such payments are appropriate and in the best interests of ADI and our shareholders, after taking into consideration changing business conditions and the performance of our employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Roche and Zinsner have change in control retention agreements that contain provisions regarding Section 280G of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2009, any new executive compensation arrangements for new executives do not contain tax gross up provisions for excess parachute payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expense in our financial statements the compensation that we pay to our executive officers, as required by U.S. generally accepted accounting principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As one of many factors, the Compensation Committee considers the financial statement impact in determining the amount of, and allocation among the elements of, compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We account for stock-based compensation under our 2006 Stock Incentive Plan and all predecessor plans in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Considerations in Our Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee has reviewed our incentive compensation programs, discussed the concept of risk as it relates to our compensation program, considered various mitigating factors and reviewed these items with its independent consultant, PM.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our Compensation Committee asked PM to conduct an independent risk assessment of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on these reviews and discussions, the Compensation Committee does not believe our compensation program encourages excessive or inappropriate risk taking for the following reasons:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We structure our pay to consist of both fixed and variable compensation with short- and long-term horizons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fixed (salary) portion of compensation is designed to provide a steady income regardless of ADIs stock price performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The variable (cash bonus, stock option, time-based RSU and performance-based RSU) portions of compensation are designed to reward both short- and long-term corporate performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For short-term performance, our cash bonus is awarded based on OPBT margin and year-over-year revenue growth targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For long-term performance, our employee stock option awards generally vest in equal installments over five years and our time-based RSUs generally vest in full on the third anniversary of the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For our 2016 annual equity award cycle, our NEOs received approximately 33% of the value of their equity grants in the form of performance-based RSUs, which will vest based on our TSR over a three-year period as compared to a selected group of peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of all of their equity grants is exclusively dependent on our stock price performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We feel that these variable elements of compensation are a sufficient percentage of overall compensation to motivate executives to produce superior short- and long-term corporate results, while the fixed element is also sufficiently high that the executives are not encouraged to take unnecessary or excessive risks in doing so.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because OPBT margin and year-over-year revenue growth are the performance measures for determining our cash incentive payments, we believe our executives are encouraged to take a balanced approach that focuses on corporate operating profit before taxes as a percentage of revenue and year-over-year revenue growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we do not achieve positive year-over-year revenue growth, bonus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: payments for that element of the executive performance incentive are not paid, and no payments are made under the program if we achieve OPBT margin of 20% or less.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our focus on both OPBT margin and year-over-year revenue growth through our executive performance incentive plan, and stock price performance through our equity compensation program provides a check on excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: That is, even if our executives could inappropriately increase OPBT margin or revenue by excessively reducing expenses or adding new revenue sources that are inconsistent with our business model, this would be detrimental to ADI in the long run and could ultimately harm our stock price and the value of their equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Conversely, if our executives were to add revenue sources at low margins in order to generate a higher growth multiple and increased stock prices, it could decrease OPBT margin and the value of their cash bonus payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, we believe our compensation program has appropriate balance and incentives to produce superior short- and long-term corporate results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our OPBT margin and year-over-year revenue targets are applicable to our executives and employees alike across the organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this encourages consistent behavior across the organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We cap our bonus payout factors at 300% of target and our bonus payouts are also subject to the 162(m) plan limitations for participants in that plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To achieve a 300% bonus payout in a quarter, we would have to achieve both OPBT margin at or above 40% and year-to-year revenue growth at or above 28%, which were determined by the Compensation Committee to be very challenging.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if we dramatically exceed our OPBT margin or year-over-year revenue growth targets, bonus payments are limited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Conversely, we have a floor on the OPBT margin target so that profitability below a certain level will result in no bonus payments, regardless of revenue growth levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this avoids incentivizing management to drive revenue levels without regard to profitability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have strict accounting policies and internal controls over the measurement and calculation of OPBT margin and revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, we do not recognize product revenue until our distributors sell those products to their customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, our product revenue fully reflects end customer purchases and is not impacted by distributor inventory levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our stock ownership guidelines provide an incentive for management to consider ADIs long-term interests because a portion of their personal investment portfolio consists of ADI stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we prohibit all hedging transactions involving our stock so our directors, executives and employees cannot insulate themselves from the effects of ADI stock price performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our directors and executive officers are prohibited from holding any Company securities in a margin account, and, since 2013, from pledging their Company securities as collateral for a loan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have equity award grant date guidelines that prohibit the timing or coordination of grants with the release of material information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 1995, our executive officers and directors, along with some of our management and engineering employees, have been eligible to participate in our Deferred Compensation Plan, or DCP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We established the DCP to provide participants with the opportunity to defer receiving all or a portion of their compensation, which includes salary, bonus, commissions and director fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our DCP, we provide all participants (other than non-employee directors) with Company contributions equal to 8% of eligible deferred contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Before January 1, 2005, participants could also defer gains on stock options and restricted stock awards that were granted before July 23, 1997.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We credit each participants account with earnings on the deferred amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These earnings represent the amounts that the participant would have earned if the deferred amounts had been invested in one or more of the various investment options selected by the participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of the DCP, only the payment of the compensation earned is deferred; we do not defer the expense in our financial statements related to the participants deferred compensation and investment earnings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We charge the salary, bonuses, commissions, director fees and investment earnings on deferred balances to our income statement as an expense in the period in which the participant earned the compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our balance sheet includes separate line items for Deferred Compensation Plan Investments and Deferred Compensation Plan Liabilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We hold DCP assets in a separate Rabbi trust segregated from other assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We invest in the same investment alternatives that the DCP participants select for their DCP balances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants whose employment with us terminates due to retirement after reaching age 62 with ten years of service, disability or death will be paid their DCP balance in either a lump sum or in installments over ten or fewer years, based on the elections they have made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants (other than key employees, including our NEOs) who terminate their employment with us for any other reason will receive payment of their DCP balance in the form of a lump sum upon their termination of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payments to our NEOs and key employees will be delayed six months and as otherwise required by relevant tax regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Real was not eligible to participate in the DCP in fiscal 2016 because it is available only to U.S. taxpayers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Meaney ceased eligibility upon his relocation to Ireland in January 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control Retention Agreements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have entered into change in control retention agreements with each of our executive officers (other than Mr. Hess) and other key employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These agreements provide for severance benefits if any of the following occurs:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: within 24 months after a change in control (as defined in each agreement) that was approved by our Board of Directors, we terminate the employees employment with us for a reason other than cause (as defined in the agreement) or the employees death or disability;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: within 24 months after a change in control that was approved by our Board of Directors, the employee terminates his or her employment for good reason (as defined in the agreement); or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: within 12 months after a change in control that was not approved by our Board of Directors, we or the employee terminates the employees employment with us for a reason other than cause (as defined in the agreement) or the employees death or disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of our change in control retention agreements, a change in control occurs when:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: any person or entity becomes the beneficial owner of 30% or more of the combined voting power of our outstanding securities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our shareholders approve specified mergers of ADI with another entity; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our shareholders approve a plan of liquidation or sale of all, or substantially all, of ADIs assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These agreements provide for the following severance benefits in the event of termination following a change in control approved by the Board of Directors:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a lump-sum payment equal to 200% (299% in the case of certain employees who are parties to the agreements, including each of our NEOs) of the sum of the employees annual base salary (as of the date of termination or the date of the change in control, whichever is higher) plus 200% (299% in the case of certain employees who are parties to the agreements, including each of our NEOs) of the total cash bonuses paid or awarded to him or her in the four fiscal quarters preceding his or her termination;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: payment of all legal fees and expenses incurred by the employee as a result of such termination (including all such fees and expenses, if any, incurred in disputing such termination or in seeking to obtain or enforce any right or benefit provided by the agreement or in connection with tax audit or proceeding to the extent attributable to the application of Section 4999 of the Internal Revenue Code to any payment or benefit provided under the agreement); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the continuation of life, disability, dental, accident and group health insurance benefits for a period of 24 months.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If payments to the employee under his or her agreement (together with any other payments or benefits, including the accelerated vesting of stock options or restricted stock awards that the employee receives in connection with a change in control) would trigger the provisions of Sections 280G and 4999 of the Internal Revenue Code, the change in control employee retention agreements provide for the payment of an additional amount so that the employee receives, net of excise taxes, the amount he or she would have been entitled to receive in the absence of the excise tax imposed by Section 4999 of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In September 2009, our Compensation Committee eliminated this provision from any new employee retention agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each agreement provides that, in the event of a potential change in control (as defined in each agreement), the employee will not voluntarily resign as an employee, subject to certain conditions, for at least six months after the change in control occurs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews these agreements each year, and the agreements automatically renew each year unless we give the employee three months notice that his or her agreement will not be extended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hess Employment Agreement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with our acquisition of Hittite, we entered into an employment agreement with Mr. Hess that provides for severance benefits if any of the following occurs:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: within 24 months after a change in control (as defined in the agreement), we terminate Mr. Hess employment for any reason other than misconduct (as defined in the agreement) or Mr. Hess death or disability; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: within 24 months after a change in control, Mr. Hess terminates his employment for good reason (as defined in the agreement).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of Mr. Hess employment agreement, a change in control occurs:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: when any person or entity becomes the beneficial owner of 50% or more of the combined voting power of our outstanding securities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: upon the closing of specified mergers of ADI with another entity;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: when our shareholders approve a plan of liquidation; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: upon the closing of the sale of all, or substantially all, of ADIs assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain transactions described above may not be treated as a change in control where necessary for compliance with Section 409A of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hess employment agreement provides for the following severance benefits in the event of termination following a change in control, conditioned on his execution and delivery of a release of all potential claims against us:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annual base salary, plus a lump sum payment in an amount equal to the excess, if any, of 299% of Mr. Hess annual base salary (as of the date of termination or the date of the change of control, whichever is higher) over the amount equal to Mr. Hess annual base salary;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: target cash bonus for the year in which the termination occurred, plus a lump sum payment of the excess, if any, of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (x) 299% of the aggregate cash bonuses paid or awarded to Mr. Hess for the four fiscal quarters preceding the effective date of termination, over
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (y) the amount equal to the product of Mr. Hess target cash incentive bonus for the year in which termination occurs, multiplied by the sum of 1.0 plus a fraction equal to the quotient of the number of days during such year in which he was employed by us, divided by 365;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: payment of all legal fees (excluding taxes) incurred by Mr. Hess as a result of such termination (including all such fees and expenses, if any, incurred in disputing such termination or seeking to obtain or enforce any right or benefit provided by the employment agreement or in connection with tax audit or proceeding to the extent attributable to the application of Section 4999 of the Internal Revenue Code to any payment or benefit provided under the agreement); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the continuation of life, disability, dental, accident and group health insurance benefits for a period of 24 months, except where continued coverage may result in penalties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hess Employment Agreement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Mr. Hess employment agreement and in addition to the change in control severance benefits that Mr. Hess may be entitled to as described above under Change in Control Benefits  Mr. Hess Employment Agreement:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: if we terminate Mr. Hess employment for a reason other than misconduct (as defined in the agreement) or his death or disability;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: if Mr. Hess terminates his employment for good reason (as defined in the agreement); or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: if Mr. Hess resigns voluntarily at any time after the second anniversary of the closing date of our acquisition of Hittite,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: then, conditioned on his execution and delivery of a release of all potential claims against us, Mr. Hess will be entitled to receive a payment equal to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hess annual base salary, plus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the product of Mr. Hess target cash incentive bonus for the year in which termination of employment occurs, multiplied by the sum of 1.0 plus a fraction equal to the quotient of the number of days during such year in which he was employed by us, divided by 365, plus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the difference between the cost of COBRA continuation coverage for Mr. Hess and any dependent who received health insurance coverage prior to such termination for one year and any premium contribution amount applicable to him as of such termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in the event of Mr. Hess involuntary termination (other than for misconduct) or Mr. Hess resignation with good eason, the remaining unvested portion of the equity awards we granted in replacement of Hittite awards in connection with our acquisition of Hittite will be accelerated such that all such awards are fully vested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Meaneys Separation Letter Agreement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On September 19, 2016 we announced that Mr. Meaney would be leaving the Company at the end of the 2016 calendar year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with Mr. Meaneys separation from the Company, we entered into a Separation Letter Agreement that provided for the following severance benefits in exchange for a release of claims in favor of the Company:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a lump sum payment equal to two years base salary based on an annual base salary of $465,000 and two years bonus at target, plus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: continuation of health insurance benefits for one year, plus
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: $16,000 towards obtaining independent tax advice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in consideration of Mr. Meaneys execution of a non-competition and non-solicitation agreement, as of his separation date, all outstanding stock options, time-based RSUs and performance-based RSUs that were scheduled to vest on or before March 31, 2017, accelerated and vested in full.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The equity awards subject to performance-based vesting criteria vested as if all applicable performance parameters had been met at target levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All other outstanding and unvested equity awards were forfeited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payments upon a change in control for our NEOs (other than Mr. Hess) are calculated based upon the change-in-control retention agreements described above under Change in Control Benefits  Change in Control Retention Agreements and, in the case of Mr. Hess, his employment agreement described above under Change in Control Benefits  Mr. Hess Employment Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our 2006 Stock Incentive Plan, in the event of a change in control, all of our employees, including our NEOs, if they remain employed by ADI, would have one-half of the shares of common stock subject to their then-outstanding unvested options accelerate and become immediately exercisable and one-half of their unvested RSUs would vest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The remaining one-half of the unvested options or RSUs would continue to vest in accordance with the original vesting schedules, and any remaining unvested options or RSUs would vest if, on or prior to the first anniversary of the change in control, his or her employment is terminated without cause or for good reason (as defined in the plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon a change in control approved by the Board of Directors (for all executive officers other than Mr. Hess) or a change in control in the case of Mr. Hess, if we terminate an executive officers employment for cause (or misconduct in the case of Mr. Hess) or if the executive officer terminates his or her employment other than for good reason (in the case of Mr. Hess, before the second anniversary of the closing date of our acquisition of Hittite), then the executive officer will receive his or her full base salary and all other compensation through the date of termination at the rate in effect at the time that the termination notice is given and we will have no further obligations to the executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When the employment of an executive officer (other than Mr. Hess) terminates in a situation that does not involve a change in control, the officer is entitled to receive the same benefits as any other terminating employee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This applies regardless of the reason for termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hess is entitled to severance benefits in specified circumstances following the termination of his employment that does not involve a change in control, as described above in  Severance Benefits  Mr. Hess Employment Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Award Program Description
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our equity award program is a broad-based, long-term employee retention program that is intended to attract, retain and motivate our employees, officers and directors and to align their interests with those of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our 2006 Stock Incentive Plan, we may grant options to purchase shares of our common stock, stock appreciation rights, restricted stock, restricted stock units and other stock-based awards to all employees, officers, directors, consultants and advisors of ADI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All stock options have a term of ten years, and for employees, generally vest in five equal installments on each of the first, second, third, fourth and fifth
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: anniversaries of the date of grant, subject to full or partial acceleration upon death, disability or a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2006 Stock Incentive Plan does not permit us to grant options at exercise prices that are below the fair market value of our common stock on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, our employee time-based RSUs vest in full on the third anniversary of the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our performance-based RSUs have three year performance periods under which the number of shares of ADI common stock received following vesting, if any, will be based on ADIs TSR performance measured against the median TSR of a comparator group of companies over the three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our RSUs are subject to full or partial acceleration upon death, disability or a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We can make equity award grants to executive officers and directors only from shareholder-approved plans after the Compensation Committee reviews and approves the grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All members of the Compensation Committee are independent directors, as defined by the NASDAQ Rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employee Service Award Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Employee Service Award Program is designed to recognize and thank employees for their long-term working relationship with ADI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All regular employees other than executive officers are eligible to receive these awards in the form of shares of our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers receive these awards in cash instead of stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We grant these awards to employees starting with the employees tenth anniversary of employment with us, and after the tenth anniversary, we grant the awards at the end of each subsequent five-year period of employment with us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of the award at the employees tenth anniversary with us is $1,000 and the value of the award increases by $500 at each subsequent five-year service milestone.

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 4  RATIFICATION OF SELECTION OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention and oversight of the Companys independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To execute this responsibility, the Audit Committee engages in an annual evaluation of the independent registered public accounting firms qualifications, performance and independence and whether the retention of the independent public accounting firm is in the best interest of the Company and our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Audit Committee has selected the firm of Ernst & Young LLP, independent registered public accounting firm, as our auditors for the 2017 fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ernst & Young LLP, or its predecessor firms, has served as our independent registered public accounting firm continuously since 1965.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with SEC rules and Ernst & Young LLP policies, the firms lead engagement partner rotates every five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Audit Committee and its Chairman are directly involved in the selection of Ernst & Young LLPs lead engagement partner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also has the sole authority to approve all engagement fees paid to our independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee and the Board of Directors believe that the continued retention of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm is in the best interest of the Company and our shareholders, and we are asking our shareholders to ratify the selection of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the 2017 fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although shareholder approval of the selection of Ernst & Young LLP is not required by law, our Board of Directors believes that it is advisable to give shareholders an opportunity to ratify this selection.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If this proposal is not approved by our shareholders at the Annual Meeting, our Audit Committee will reconsider its selection of Ernst & Young LLP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if the selection is ratified, the Audit Committee may in its discretion select a different independent registered public accounting firm at any time during the year if it determines that such change would be in the best interest of the Company and our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Representatives of Ernst & Young LLP are expected to be present at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They will have the opportunity to make a statement if they desire to do so and will also be available to respond to appropriate questions from shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors recommends that you vote FOR the ratification of the selection of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the 2017 fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-GAAP financial measures included in this Proxy Statement, including free cash flow and free cash flow margin, are financial measures that are not in accordance with, nor an alternative to, generally accepted accounting principles and may be different from non-GAAP measures used by other companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, these non-GAAP measures are not based on any comprehensive set of accounting rules or principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management uses non-GAAP measures internally to evaluate the Companys operating performance from continuing operations against past periods and to budget and allocate resources in future periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management believes that the non-GAAP liquidity measure free cash flow is useful both internally and to investors because it provides information about the amount of cash generated after capital expenditures that is then available to repay debt obligations, make investments and fund acquisitions, and for certain other activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following item is excluded from our calculation of Non-GAAP free cash flow:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension Conversion Payments: In the fourth quarter of fiscal 2015, the Company made payments as a result of the conversion of the benefits provided to participants in the Companys Irish defined benefit pension plan to benefits provided under the Companys Irish defined contribution plan including settlement charges, legal, accounting and other professional fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We excluded these payments from our non-GAAP free cash flow measure because they relate to a specific transaction and are not reflective of our ongoing financial performance.

sentences.text: Analog Devices believes that non-GAAP measures have material limitations in that they do not reflect all of the amounts associated with our results of operations as determined in accordance with GAAP and that these measures should only be used to evaluate our results of operations in conjunction with the corresponding GAAP measures.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys use of non-GAAP measures, and the underlying methodology when excluding certain items, is not necessarily an indication of the results of operations that may be expected in the future, or that the Company will not, in fact, record such items in future periods.
